loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: Mwanarusi is a widowed woman with five children who are adults. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Mwanarusi sells makuti (palm leaves) used for thatching roof tops. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and she faces stiff competition from other makuti sellers. With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more makuti for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase makuti (palm leaves) for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a woman who is forty-one years old and married to John. She is the mother of three children. She sells electronics and phone accessories, and has been in this business for seven years now. Jane gets a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be Jane's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy phone accessories for sale. In the future she wants to open another shop.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions and overpopulation. Interestingly, the rooms are bit cheaper, one has the option of traveling, the area contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia and food rates are low.

Rebecca is married, and her husband works in a beer factory in Monrovia. They both have four children aged between 15 and 25. Only two of their children currently attend school and live at home. Rebecca was unable to attend school, but she started a table market business where she bakes and sells bread. With the loan proceeds she will buy flour, sugar and oil to increase her sales. Her problem is fewer goods on her table. She has no additional problems for now. With a little money from her husband she managed to established this business, and learned by observing other businesswomen ten years ago. She stated that she enjoys the fast buying from costumers. She dreams of moving from a table business to a shop business and to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: she will buy flour, sugar and oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of four children. One child is in school. The rest are adults. She lives in a rented house with electricity and piped water. 

Christine operates a tailor shop and has been in this business for over two years. Her major challenge is seasonality.

She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to receive financial support. With a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase fabric, materials and thread for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, materials and thread for her business

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a nurse with many years of experience. She works at a local clinic in Artashat town, where she lives with her husband. 

Tereza's monthly salary is hardly enough to cover the family's basic costs. To tackle financial hardship, she has also been involved in agriculture for five years. Jointly with her husband, Tereza keeps chickens, turkeys and pigs. The couple also owns two greenhouses, where they cultivate haricots, tomatoes and greens and grow different types of trees (peach, apricot, nut and apple). Agriculture is the family's main source of income. 

Tereza has applied for this loan to purchase an ox, grass for feeding it and compressed forage for her livestock. This loan will greatly help Tereza to feed her livestock and continue her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, grass for feeding it and compressed forage for her livestock

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian esta separada del esposo, tiene dos hijas con las cuales vive en casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja vendiendo artesanias, el esposo le pasa una asistencia familiar para sus hijas, el credito que solicita es para construir un garage en su domiclio, con el cual ella podra generar un ingresos adicional que le permita solventar sus minimos gastos tanto de alimentacion y estudios de ella y de sus hijas.

El sueño de Vivian es darles una profesion a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Vivian is separated from her husband. She has two daughters with whom she lives in her own home in the city of La Paz.

Right now she works selling artisanal crafts. Her husband gives her child support for her daughters. The loan she is taking out is to build a garage at her house. With it, she will be able to generate some additional income that will allow her to pay her minimal expenses such as food and education for her and her daughters.

Vivian's dream is to help her daughter's have good careers.

loans.use: to build a garage at her house.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and has six children. After successfully graduating vocational school, Ekua is now an established businesswoman. She sells meats and pineapples in a location near Cape Coast. She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of meat and pineapples, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of meat and pineapples

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Antonia una mujer emprendedora, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar la Tierra, sembrando Piñas, Pitahaya. pero con esta actividad no podia realizar sus metas y logros, como mejorar su vivienda y sobre todo mejorar sus condiciones de vida. desde hace ya un año ella vende frutas y verduras en un tramito y gracias a Dios  le esta llendo muy bien ya que sus ingresos han aumentado y sus familia junto con ella se sienten felices, con este nuevo credito la señora Antonia invertira en su inventario comprando mas frutas y verdura ademas quiere darle un pequeño Mantenimiento a su puesto de venta. muy contenta agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado todos estos años.
texts.en:
Antonia, an enterprising woman, lives in the Ticuantepe municipality.  She has been working the land for many years.  She grows pineapples and dragon fruit.  However, with this business activity she was not able to meet her goals like improving her house, and most of all, her living conditions.  She has been selling fruit and vegetables at a stall.  Thanks to God, it is going very well for her.  Her income has increased, and her family is happy.

With this new loan Antonia will invest in her inventory by purchasing more fruits and vegetables.  She also wants to do a little maintenance work on her sales stand.  She is very happy and grateful for the support that AFODENIC and Kiva have given her all of these years.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Millonarias Del Dorado Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sila Elva, tiene 48 años de edad, es viuda. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las Millonarias del Dorado", formado por siete socios, ellos mismos eligieron su nombre ya que es uno de sus deseos poder llegar a esa condición económica para lo cual se esfuerzan mucho con su trabajo.
Desde hace año y medio Sila Elva se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, es un negocio que le permite elegir horarios y conocer gente, le agrada mucho este negocio y procura aumentar su clientela en cada campaña.
Sila Elva, invertirá el préstamo recibido en la compra de perfumes que se encuentran en promoción en el catalogo actual con lo cual le permitirá tener un stock de productos y obtener un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Sila Elva is 48 years old. She is a widow. She is a part of the "Las Millonarias del Dorado" [The Dorado Millionaires] group, made up of seven members. She picked the name themselves, since one of the things they want is reach that financial condition, and to do that they work hard. 

For a year and a half, Sila Elva has sold beauty products via catalogues. It is a business that allows her to choose her schedule and meet people. She really likes this business and always tries to grow her clientele.

Sila Elva will invest the loan she receives in buying perfumes that are on sale right now in the present catalog. This will allow her to stock products and obtain a bigger profit margin.

loans.use: to invest in buying beauty products.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 42 years old and she lives with her family in Kapan city. She is married and she has two children. Her daughter is married and she lives separately with her family. Her son is 22 years old and he works as a worker at a construction company. Anahit and her husband are also employed. 

Recently Anahit’s son had a car accident in which fortunately nobody was injured, but as you can see in photo, their car was damaged greatly and it needs serious repairs. 

Anahit asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since they need to repair their car, but they have no enough money for it.

loans.use: to repair their personal car

loans.name: Carlos Amilcar

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 21 años de edad, casado con un hijo.  Se dedica a la venta de pan en su motocicleta desde hace 5 años. Antes se dedicaba al trabajo de la agricultura. El pan que él vende, son de la panadería que se encuentra a unos 20 minutos de su cantón del cual es empleado.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir  un muro perimetral y realizar unas mejoras en su casa. Con el crédito, podrá hacer un muro para dividir su propiedad con la del vecino y tener mas privacidad, y poner ladrillo de piso en su casa; ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra, y el niño camina en el suelo que no es muy saludable para él.

Su objetivo, es trabajar duro y pagar rápido el préstamo, para tramitar un crédito mas grande y poder ampliar mas  su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 21 year old man. He is married and has one son. He has sold bread from his motorcycle for 5 years. Previously, he worked in farming. The bread he sells is from a bread bakery that is 20 minutes from his canton and he is an employee. 

The loan he is asking for is to build a wall around his property and to some home improvement. With the loan, he will be able to build a wall to divide his property from his neighbor's and have more privacy, as well as put in a brick floor in his house. Right now, it has a dirt floor and his son walks on the floor and it isn't very healthy for him. 

His goal is to work hard and pay off the loan quickly in order to take out a bigger loan and make his house bigger.

loans.use: to build a wall around the property and do some home improvement.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
40-year-old Victoria lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals, fewer bathrooms,  filthy conditions, and over-population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, the area contain one of the biggest markets in Liberia,  and food is less expensive.    

Victoria is single and has five children whose ages are between 23 and 18; only one of her children is currently attending school and lives at home. Victoria was unfortunate not to attend school, but she is busy running her shop which sells charcoal in the local  market. 

With the loan proceeds she will buy more charcoal for her business. She said, "Besides few goods on my table market, I have no other problems for now." With a little money from her mother, she managed to established this business six years ago, and learned from seeing other businesswomen. She stated, "I enjoy the flow of customers and the fast buying.  My dreams are to move from the charcoal business to a store business, and live a better life in future."

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Athman

texts.en:
Athman lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a married man with two children. He has been selling cooked food for the last three years and this is his full-time business. He has employed two people to help run the business and this has seen his business grow. 

Athman learned about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy foodstuffs and utensils for the business. The challenge in the business is that most people want to eat on credit and refuse to pay. The extra income that he will raise will help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and utensils

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 44 años de edad. Aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, desde temprana edad, ya que su familia siempre se a dedicado a esa actividad productiva el cual a sido el sustento familiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pesticidas, herbicidas, abonos, vitaminas, medicamentos, harina, sal, para el ganado. Con el préstamo, podrá darle mejor mantenimiento a sus potreros, sembrara mas pastos y  podrá dar mejor cuido a sus animales.

Con el mejor mantenimiento a los terrenos, al ganado y cerdos, podrá vender a mejores precios los animales y obtener mejores ingresos económicos y así poder cubrir algunas necesidades de su familia.

Él desea, con los ingresos instalar un comedor en el pueblo, comprar más ganado y cerdos.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 44, learned to farm and work with livestock at an early age.  This is because his family always did this productive work, which was the family’s support.

The loan that he is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to buy pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, vitamins, medications, flour, and salt for his livestock.  With the loan he will be able to improve the maintenance of his pastures.  

He will plant more grass, and he will be able to improve the care of his animals.  With the improved maintenance of the land, he will be able to sell his animals for better prices and get better income.  This way he will be able to cover some of his family’s necessities.

With the income he wishes to set up an eatery in the village and to buy more cattle and pigs.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides, fertilizers, vitamins, medications, flour, and salt for his livestock.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en:
Jartu lives in Paynesville South Area. She is 45 years old and is married with five children between 19 and 30. Only one is in school and lives at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal. She says she is proud of her business because of her daily savings. It was her oldest brother who help her to start this business with a little amount of money.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. In future, she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna lives in New Kru town. She is 45 years old, single, and she has three children between 13 and 20 years old. They are in school and live at home. Joanna was unfortunate unable to attend school, but she has been keeping herself busy with her business over the past 4 years by selling water in the local market. 

She started this business with a little money from her mother. She said; fewer items on her table to sell are the only challenge she faces. She likes her business because it is affordable and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She mentions, "I am proud of my business because it is the only means my family is surviving." With the loan she is going to buy more water to resell.  Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more water to resell.

loans.name: Elamie

texts.en:
Elamie is 41 years old and lives in Paynesville South Area which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a driver. Together they have five children between 12 and 20 years old; they are currently in school and live at home.

For the past thirty years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has lots of customers since her business is in a very good location. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags for her business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Nor Ughi village of Ararat region with her two grown-up children and husband.

Karine works at the local post office and together with her family has been involved in agriculture for eight years. Currently Karine keeps livestock (cows, pigs, turkeys and calves). Near the village where the family lives, Karine owns a plot of land where different type of fruits and vegetables are cultivated (greens, peaches, apricots, plums, nuts, apples and pears). Karine's husband sells the gathered harvest in the local villages and so provides income for the family's well-being.

In order to overcome financial difficulties that family currently is facing, Karine's son went abroad to find a well-paid job to sustain his family. 

Realizing the importance of agricultural income, Karine would like to expand her farm. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase two oxen and forage to feed her livestock. The loan will greatly assist Karine and her family to enlarge their farm and gather more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy two oxen and forage to feed her livestock.

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en:
Benetta lives in New Kru town. She is 28 years old, married, and has three children between 7 and 9 years old. They are in school and live at home. 

Benetta did not go to school, so she decided to keep herself busy with business by selling foodstuffs like palm oil, rice, etc. to improve her life. She started this business with a little money from her husband two years ago. She said that few goods on her table is the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She said, "I am proud of my business because it is the only means I have to help my children. Benetta said that with the loan she is going to buy more palm oil, rice, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children who are still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a business of selling 'leso' ( women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of cloth in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 40 lengths of 'lesos'  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 lengths of 'Lesos' (women's wrap) for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, maize flour, rice and water. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell in the shop. This will help Peter to generate greater profits and take care of his children and other basic needs. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a supermarket. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as maize flour, sugar and rice to sell in the shop.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is 41 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Hope has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. 

To help expand her business, Hope has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed for the farm and will help Hope to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and build rental houses. Hope believes that in the future she will be able to add more chickens to the farm to expand it more. 

Hope is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hope who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed for the farm

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 50 years old and married with three children. She runs a local food business in Rokupr in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She began her business because she needed to get an income.

She’s been in this business for 10 years and sells native rice, beans, and bulgur. Fatmata says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gari, native rice and bulgur. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house and open a savings account. In the future, she would like to build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gari, native rice and bulgur.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda lives in Paynesville, South Area. She is 18 years old and single. Finda is also a sixth grade dropout. For the past three years now, Finda has been selling bread in a bucket around communities. She started this business with a small amount of money that she earned by selling cold water. Finda says she enjoys the business from her customers and the money she generates from her business every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house and go back to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is the mother of two children who go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Lucy operates a salon and has been in this business for over three years. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair shampoos, and hair oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair shampoos, and hair oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional night dresses, curtains, and bed sheets

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude lives in Mombasa Kenya and she is 44 years old. She is married with four children. For more than a year she has been running a fast food business in town and the business has been doing great. She has been able to employ four people to help her run the business. 

She heard of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy sacks of potatoes and cooking oil to add to the business. The challenge in the business is competition from other traders as well as food prices which are never stable. The money she will raise will improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Eletha

texts.en: Eletha lives in Paynesville, South Area a populace area in Montserrado County. She is 48 years old and she is married with a child aged 27 years old. Her child is currently in college and lives at home. Since 2002 she has been selling used clothing in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money received from her husband. She enjoys the business from her customers and the money that she generates. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to enlarge her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to enlarge her business

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a married woman with two children in school.She lives in her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Mwanalima has operated a beauty salon business for the past year. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase hair shampoos, braids, hair oil, chemicals and hair conditioners for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair shampoos, braids, hair oil, chemicals and hair conditioners for her business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 48 years old and lives in Paynesville South Area, which is a populace area in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a security officer. They both have six children between 21 and 28 years old. Only one is currently in school and five live at home. For the past eight years, Christiana has been selling rubber dishes (pans, bowls, cups, spoons, etc.) in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (pans, bowls, cups, spoons, etc.) for her business. She plans to build a house and own a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (pans, bowls, cups, spoons, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
You are most welcome to meet Annie from Liberia who is a widow. She is 46 years old and has six children who live at home; three of them are in school.  Her oldest child age is 30 and the last child age is 14.  

She has been operating a local restaurant in order to pay for her children's school, and maintain her home happily. She explains she is going to buy additional bags of rice, oil, pepper, charcoal, etc. Annie uses a shared taxi all the time to bring her goods to her local restaurant. She began her business right after her high-school days with a small amount of money which she gathered from her parents.

She is happy at her business because it is the only source of income and allows her to generate money to sustain her family. All her dreams and hopes are to one day be an owner of a big store, and see all her children through university.  She congratulates BRAC Liberia for their partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice, oil, pepper and charcoal.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is single and has three children.  Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful trader. She sells watermelon and mangoes in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. 

As the sole breadwinner, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of watermelon and mangoes, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of fruit she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of watermelon and mangoes, thus helping her to increase her sales.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is requesting a loan of KSH 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  She hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income still more and improve her family’s conditions.

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Kindly meet Oretha from Liberia who is single and has an 11-year-old child. She attended grade school and stopped her study in the 6th grade. Her child lives with her and attends school. She explains how she has been going to the wholesale store to buy used clothes to resell in order to make ends meet. She sells from 8am to 5pm Monday to Saturday. She uses a taxi to get her goods from the store. She started this business by selling corn on the roadside with a little money from her mother, who taught her how to do this business. She expresses how she enjoys the buying, and she is proud of her business because she believes God directs more customers to her business every time. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house. Also she hopes that her child will have a brighter future as she is trying her best to educate them. She gives thanks to the lenders of Kiva for supporting the program and empowering small business people; God should bless them.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to resell in order to make ends meet

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: 35-year-old Mamie is from Liberia. She and her fiancé are living together, and they have a six-year-old child who attends school. She lives in the Paynesville south area. She calls herself a businesswoman because she is business minded. She finished school after 1st grade. She has a shop where she sells goods such as soap, rice, toothpaste, sardines, oil, razor blades, batteries and drinks. Presently she is not facing many problems with her business, but she would like to increase her sales. She opens her shop from 7am to 10pm every day. She uses a taxi most of the time to take her goods to her shop. Mamie established this business by running a waiter market with a little money from her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys selling to her customers and she is proud because her business is growing every day. She intends to buy additional goods to increase her sales. Her future plans are to build a house and send her only child to college. She says thanks to those who lend to BRAC Liberia, because "it is through them that BRAC Liberia gives us money, and we are able to stand on our own."

loans.use: to buy additional goods to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mayealie

texts.en:
Mayealie is 45 years old and married with five children between the ages of 9 and 25. She runs a local food business in the Port Loko Northern area in Sierra Leone. She began her business because she needed to earn an income to be independent. 

She’s been in this business since 2009 and sells palm oil, coconut and bulgur. Mayealie says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Mayealie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gari, palm oil and bulgur.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house and open a savings account. In the future, she would like to build a big house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gari, palm oil and bulgur.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana vive en la ciudad de La Paz. Actualmente trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada por mas de ocho horas al dia y con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación,alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de sus estudios de actualización ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para cubrir el pago de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Liliana lives in the city of La Paz.  Currently she works for a private business more than eight hours a day.  With her income she has to cover her expenses for food, rent, and basic services.

Liliana needs the loan to pay for a refresher course.  She's not able to cover the payment with what little she earns.

loans.use: to pay for a refresher course

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married with five school children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sofia has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene 38 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando en la primaria en una escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación. Su compañero de hogar es maestro de educación primaria siendo el su apoyo para el trabajo en sus cultivos de café los cuales están ubicados a 10 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que sus padres quienes han sido agricultores desde toda una vida le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que solo pudo cursar hasta el sexto grado culminando su primaria decidió a prender a trabajar la tierra para apoyar a sus padres.   

Sus Sueños son los de mejorar y ampliar sus cultivos de café, sus tierra sembrando una mejor variedad, un producto más atractivo para sus clientes de esa forma generara mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar asegurando la educación de sus hijos y su bienestar. Es por ello que ha solicitado un financiamiento el cual invertirá en la compra de 26 QQ de abono 12-24-12, 15 QQ de urea y 3 QQ de abono foliar para asistir y asegurar sus cultivos al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
María Isabel is 38 years old and is a stay-at-home mom and farmer.  She is mother of three children in elementary school. Her life partner is an elementary school teacher who also helps her with the coffee crops that are located about 10 kilometers from her house and which she reaches by foot.  She has a lot of experience in this field since her parents, who have been farmers their whole lives, taught her to work the land from a very young age. She was only able to finish sixth grade, and upon finishing primary school decided to begin working the land with her parents.

Her dreams are to improve and expand her coffee fields, to plant a larger variety of crops, and to have a more attractive product for her customers so that she can increase her income in order to support her family and provide her children with well-being and a good education.  For this reason she is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of 26 Quintal (QQ - or a Honduran unit of mass) of 12-24-12 fertilizer, 15 Quintal of urea, and 3 Quintal of liquid foliage fertilizer (abono foliar) in order to help the crops and to ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products for growing coffee.

loans.name: Faustina's Group

texts.en:
This group of five women decided to join together so that they can access a loan to run their businesses to compete with other traders who are selling the same products. They engage in different businesses that involve selling wax-prints, locally made biscuits, clothing, and maize (corn).

One of the members of this group is Faustina. She is 56 years old, single, and has three children. Two of her children are independent and the youngest is 10 years old and attends school. 

Faustina has sold clothing and underwear for six years now. She sells by going door to door, but she also has a small shop in her house where she sells her products. However, most of her sales are conducted by going door to door. Faustina works every day and she practices cash and carry. Thanks to her business, she is able to put food on the table. She is standing second from the left in the photograph.

Faustina's loan of 900 GHS will be used to buy clothing and underwear to resell to customers. This is her fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she likes the fact that the loans are issued quickly. Her dream is to move forward with ID-Ghana and in her family life.

loans.use: To buy clothing and underwear to resell to customers.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is 37 years old and married with 3 children, aged 9 years and 20 years. She runs a clothing business in Rokupr, the northern area in Sierra Leone. She did not go to school so she was raised in business.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells t-shirts and slippers.  She says that at present her business is doing well.

Ramatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy t-shirts and slippers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and improve her business. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bettie

texts.en:
Bettie is 44 years old and lives at Paynesville South Area, which is a populace area in Montserrado County. She is married and has six children between 12 and 26 years old.  Only one of her children is in school and the rest live at home.  Bettie describes herself as a hardworking person.  For the past 20 years she has been running a shop where she sells rice, soap, charcoal, pepper, etc. in the local market.  

She likes her business because of the way customers respond to it. She started her business with money given to her by her husband.  She walks every day to buy her goods, since her shop is close to the local wholesales market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, soap, charcoal, pepper, etc. for her business.  She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase the volume of their business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, charcoal, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with two children who are still underage. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. She cites food as her greatest monthly expense.

Mariam has been selling Leso (women's wrap cloth) for the last one and a half years. Her potential clients are neighbors and town dwellers. She cites seasonality as a challenge in her business.

With the 15,000 KES she wants to purchase 60 pairs of Leso (women's wrap cloth) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase 60 pairs of Leso (women's wrap cloth) for resale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville South Area, which is a populace area in Montserrado County. She is married and has five children between the ages of one month old and 12 years old. They all live at home and only four attend school. She was unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past three years, Patience has been selling used clothes in the local market. Now she faces no problems. She sells every day spending ten hours at her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her husband. For her mother, she is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is a populace area in Montserrado County. She and her fiance live together and have six children. All of their children live at home and only five are in school. Unfortunately, Margret's parents did not send her to school, but she is good at managing her business. Her fiance is a construction worker who builds houses. 

For the past 15 years, she has been selling dry and fresh fish in the local market. Now she faces no problems. She spends six days a week from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM on her business. She started this business with a little income that she received from her fiance.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry and fresh fish for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry and fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Prisila

texts.en: Prisila is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase oranges, mangoes and bananas for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business thus improving her living standards. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business and attract new customers. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, mangoes and bananas for resale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Kadiatu from Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 13. Two of her children are currently attending school.  

Kadiatu runs a food stand were she sells bags of rice to her community. She has been running this business since 1990. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy bags rice and palm oil for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. The living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms, filthy conditions and over population. But the most interesting parts of New Kru include the fact that rooms are a bit cheaper, there's the option to travel, and it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and less rates of food.
    
Cecelia is 48 years old, married, and her husband is not working. They both have five children, with ages between 25 and 15; only two of their children are currently attending school and live at home. Cecelia completed 12th grade before starting this business. She has been involved with the sales of used clothes in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more used clothes to make enough sales. She said she hopes to have fewer goods on her table in the market due to increased sales. With a little money from her mother she managed to establish this business 13 years ago and she learned how to run it from observing other businesswomen. "I enjoy the flow of costumers", she said.

Cecelia's dreams are to move from the table business to a shop business, build a house, and for her and her family to live better lives in future.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to make enough sales.

loans.name: Wewee

texts.en:
You are most welcome to meet 34-year-old Wewee from Liberia. She lives in the area of Paynesville south, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is a widow, and she attended and finished grade school. She has a three-year-old child who is attending grade school and lives at home with her. 

Wewee manages her business well in order to sustain her family.  For the past two years she has been selling red oil in the local market, and for now she faces no problems. She sells six days a week, spending ten hours each day on her business. She started this business with a little money from her savings. She requested a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Bilkisu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Bilkisu from Port Loko in the northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. She also has three additional dependents at home.  

Bilkisu runs a food stand within her community, selling rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes her purchasing power is very slow. 

Bilkisu has requested a loan in order to buy more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Diego Sammir

texts.es: DIEGO SAMMIR, es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, eligió ésta carrera ya que tiene un amplio campo laboral, que le permitirá desenvolverse en los diferentes ambientes del área de la construcción. Lleva estudiando cuatro años, con buenos resultados, para culminar le falta año y medio. Uno de los obstáculos que se le ha presentado es el idioma inglés ya que la universidad lo exige como requisito para la carrera; es por eso que solicitó el préstamo para poder cubrir el pago del curso de ingles avanzado que es el que le falta para poder cumplir al 100 % con ese requisito.
texts.en:
Diego Sammir is a young student and he is studying to become a civil engineer.  He chose this career because of its broad scope of work.  He wants to be able to leverage his skills in various roles in the construction field.  He has been studying for 4 years and has earned good grades.  He has only 1.5 years left until he completes his degree.

One of the challenges he faces is that his school requires that he speaks English in order to get his degree.  This is why he is seeking a loan.  It will cover the cost of advanced English classes and this is the only thing standing in his way of meeting the requirements 100% and completing his degree.

loans.use: to pay for an advanced English course

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame sells sugarcane, doughnuts and other foodstuffs in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been educated up to the end of Junior High School. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver.

Maame has been working in this enterprise for 5 years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels sugarcane, doughnut and other food stuff. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to grow her sugarcane business and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels of sugarcane, doughnuts and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is glad to be connected with supporters of BRAC Liberia. She is 25 years old and lives in Paynesville South Area. She’s single with two children, aged 5 and 7, who are attending school and live at home. This is Grace's 2nd time being a borrower with BRAC Liberia. She has managed to get her children's school fees paid on time during the past two semesters. 

Over the past five years Grace has been selling used clothes. She has requested this loan to purchase more used clothes to increase her sales even more. She points out that having fewer goods is a challenge in her business. She started this business by selling for her mother, and lately established her own business. In the future Grace would like to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to increase her sales even more.

loans.name: Veronica   A

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Veronica from Lunsar in the Northern area. She is married and has 2 children between the ages of 2 and 7. She did not go to school and she got married at an early age.   

Veronica runs a general store from her house where she sells cigarettes, batteries, soap and sardines. She has been running this business for the past 10 years. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Veronica says that at present her business is doing well.

Veronica has requested a loan in order to buy pure water, soap, batteries and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy pure water, soap, batteries and drinks

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa lives in Paynesville which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County.  She is 34 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of  16 and 26.  Only two are in school and live at home. Theresa completed 12th grade, so she decide to keep herself busy by selling cosmetics to improve their lives. She started this business with little money from her husband two years ago. She said; fewer goods on her table are the only challenge she faces now. She likes her business because it's affordable, and she learned about this type of business from her friends. She said, "I am proud of my business because it's the only means I can help my children." Theresa said that with the loan she is going to buy more cosmetics to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Memunatu from Lunsa in the  Northern area. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 20. She began this business to create a source of income.   

Memunatu runs a general store from her house; she sells cigarettes, milk, soap and drinks. She has been running this business for the past 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week.  Memunatu says that her major problem is poor road network.

Memunatu has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, bags of milk and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and become an international business woman.  In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, bags of milk and drinks

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past year, she has operated a cereal business selling maize, beans and rice. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a weighing scale and cereals such as maize, rice and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a weighing scale and cereals such as maize, rice and beans.

loans.name: Edithor

texts.en:
Edithor is 39-year-old who lives in the town of Matuga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Edithor has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Edithor has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy maize, flour, beans and sugar for the store to sell, and will help Edithor to generate greater profits and buy a refrigerator and expand the business into a bar. Edithor hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a whole sale shop. 

Edithor is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edithor who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beans and sugar for the store to sell.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 33 years old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Barbra has been working hard to manage her retail shop selling cosmetic items. 

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetic items like body lotions to sell, and it will help Barbra to generate greater profits and take care of her child and other basic needs. Barbra hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a salon business. 

Barbra is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Barbra who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic items like body lotions to sell.

loans.name: Mirly Isabel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mirly en su negocio de elaboración de bolsos y mochilas, quien con su crédito anterior logró adicionar más productos a sus inventarios y venderlos; ella compró con su credikiva accesorios y materiales para elaborar mochilas, bolsos y esto le facilitó el incremento de su producción y con ello ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales. En la actualidad está aplicando a  un nuevo financiamiento que aplicará en la compra de insumos como hilos telas y en otra de sus actividades económicas, como la venta de refrescos y bebidas, por eso Mirly tambien comprará cervezas, aprovechando que se acercan las fiestas patronales y con ello se incrementaran sus ingresos. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva lo siguiente: “ Estoy muy agradecida y espero su aprobación en su inversión. “
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Mirly in her purse and backpack business.  With the previous loan she was able to add more products to her inventory and sell them.  She bought accessories and supplies to make backpacks and purses and this helped her increase production, and with the increase in income she was able to improve her living conditions.

She is now seeking a new loan that she will use to purchase supplies such as thread and fabric.  She will also use the loan money for her other business - she sells refreshments and beverages.  This is why she will use some of the loan money to buy beer.  She will take advantage of the upcoming national holidays to sell the beer and increase her income.

She wants to say to the Kiva lenders, "I am very thankful and I hope you will invest in me again."

loans.use: to buy supplies such as thread and fabric, and also to buy beer for sale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a 70-year-old married woman and the mother of a grown up child from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in tailoring services. She accepts dress making and dress adjustment jobs. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more cloth and other materials for sewing to accommodate all her customer's requests and increase her income. In the future, Elsa would like to expand her tailoring services to serve her customers better and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and other materials for sewing

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Memuna from Port Loko in the Northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. Two of her children are currently attending school.  

Memuna runs a food stand within her community where she sells rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business every day, 11 hours each day. She says that her business is doing well. 

She has requested a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Memuna would like to see her business grow rapidly. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isatu from Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 months and 12 years. Three of her children are currently attending school.  

Isatu runs a food stand within her community where she sells rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is poor road network within her operational area. 

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 45 years old and lives in the West point which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has two children ages 12 and 18. Both her children are going to school and live at home. She did not attend school, but she is a business woman who manages her business well. Her husband is businessman. Over the past ten years she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from her husband. She sells for six days every week, spending 10 hours with her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc., for her business. Her plan is to expand her business. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantuya, 47 years old, lives with her husband and son in an old wooden house on a plot of land in Kherlen, which is in the easternmost province of Mongolia. She has been sewing and selling clothes to local people since 1998. Her husband provides transportation services and her son works as a sentry for a private company. The wooden house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and it needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband will repair and insulate their old wooden house. The renovated house will reduce the overall usage of coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere which is significant contribution to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is very hardworking individual who wants to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Jeto

texts.en:
Jeto is a 36-year-old married man with 3 children ages 13,12 and 4 years old respectively. He hails from Getafe, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells items like coffee, sugar, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, eggs, soaps and soft drinks. 

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy a sack of rice, canned goods, and soft drinks to avoid stock shortage and serve his customer better. 

In the the future, Jeto would like to expand his sari-sari store to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, canned goods, and soft drinks to stock his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Bat-erdene, 34 years old, lives alone in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a bookkeeper at a private company since 2011. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay for the remaining costs for his automobile which runs on natural gas. He will use the automobile for a taxi service, as a way to generate additional income. He thinks extra income will be necessary when he gets married because he wants to provide his family's needs without any hardship.

loans.use: to pay the remaining costs for his automobile.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maria quien con su credikiva anterior logró adicionar más productos a sus inventarios y venderlos; ella compró con su credikiva accesorios para modistería e invirtió en productos desechables y útiles escolares. Hoy tiene mas inventarios y sus ventas han aumentado. Desde que recibió su crédito, ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida,  ayuda mas a sus familiares y por eso envía un mensaje a sus financiadores mostrándole como se encuentra: “Estoy contenta con los créditos y espero seguir contando con su apoyo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento,  porque necesita una vez mas invertir en útiles escolares, telas y accesorios de confecciones para producir y vender mucho  más y continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Maria with a previous Kiva loan.  The loan helped her to add products to her inventory and sell them.  She bought fashion accessories, school supplies, and other items.  Today she has a bigger stock and her sales have increased. 
 
Since her first loan, her living conditions have improved and she is now able to financially help her relatives.  She sends this message to the Kiva lenders: "I am very happy with the loan and I hope to continue with your support."

She is now seeking a new loan so that she can buy more school supplies, fabrics, and fashion accessories.  She wants to produce and sell more products and continue strengthening her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, fabrics, and accessories.

loans.name: Tsagaadai

texts.en: Tsagaadai is bachelor and a student who studies in a private university. He has chosen a major in rail road management, because he is quite interested in this job and job opportunities are quite high in this field after he graduates. He is responsible and a hardworking person. He is the first person in his family who is attending a university to receive a higher education degree. This loan will help him to pay the tuition fees and graduate from the university successfully.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Sanelyn

texts.en:
This is Sanelyn, 35, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Deoliste, a vendor and they have children. She, together with her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Sanelyn operates a market stall. She sells different vegetable products in the community market. She buys vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more vegetables to expand her product inventory. 

Sanelyn hopes that her business grows and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables needed for her businesss

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a mother of two children who go to school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanajuma has operated a stall selling fruits and vegetables for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: 50-year-old Massa lives in Paynesville South Area. She calls herself a businesswoman because she is business-minded. Massa is a widow and has two children aged 26 and 28 years old. For the past four years she has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with a loan from her friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells for nine hours per day from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plans are to send her child to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en: Batmunkh, 38 years old, lives alone in his wooden house on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a machinist at a power station since 1997 and is considered to be the best employee by his superiors. His wooden house is deteriorated and it needs some serious repairs. So he is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, planks, cements, fiberglass and foam. After renovation, he can live comfortably and in a warm place. Also the renovated house will enable him to burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere, contribution to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria, age 53, is married to a farmer and they live harmoniously in a small village together with their children. Her husband worked hard on their rice farm to generate income. Gregoria is planning to start her own business to increase her profits, since her two children soon will begin tertiary level and they will need to cover their education expenses. Due to insufficient capital for her business, she is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase noodles, coffee, sugar, rice bags and spices for her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and further expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, coffee, sugar, rice bags and spices for her store.

loans.name: Jelosil

texts.en:
This is Jelosil. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jelosil dreams that one day she will have a grocery store and hopes to give her family a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel owns and operates a retail store in her village.  She is married and blessed with five children. Maribel has been in this business for almost eight years. The income she makes from her sales is used to pay school fees and utility bills. Due to insufficient funds she decided to ask for a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to buy boxes of candies, detergent, soaps, toothpaste, noodles and spices. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more profits for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy boxes of candies, detergent, soaps, toothpaste, noodles and spices.

loans.name: Yanta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Yanta from Port Loko from Northern area. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 15 years and 26 years. She began this business because she was trained to be busy.   

Yanta runs sales of general stock items at her house. She sells cigarettes, milk, pure water and drinks. She has been running this business since 1982. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Yanta says that at present her business is doing fine.

She has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, bagged milk and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, drinks and bagged milk

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mado est conseillère du collectif d’affaire  « Ararati»,jeune entrepreneur, expérimentée âgée de 37 ans, veuve  et  mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse des pains sandwichs. Elle installe ses articles au  point de vente, au long de la rue de son quartier. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a environ 6 ans. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter des pains sandwichs et payer la caution auprès de son boulanger  fournisseur pour être une  cliente abonnée de premier rang enfin d’accéder à plus d’avantages (privilèges d’affaires, réduction de prix, quantité à grande échelle,  facilite de  transport et livraison à domicile, livraison à crédit, etc.)  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et construire une maison pour ses  enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Our client Mado is the leader of the Arati lenders’ group. She is a young yet experienced entrepreneur, 37 years old, a widow and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. Mado sells stuffed beads. She displays her merchandise on the street in her neighborhood. She launched her business with a loan from Hekima about six years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy stuffed breads and pay a security deposit to the bakery she stocks up from   in order to be a preferred customer and receive more advantages (better business conditions such as price reductions, ability to buy in large quantities, easier transport and home delivery, paying after delivery etc). She would like to grow her business, provide for her children’s education and build a house for them. Finally, she greatly thanks Hekima for its microloans supporting small businesses.

loans.use: to buy stuffed breads.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Isatu from Port Loko from Northern area. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 24 years. She began this business because she was trained to be busy.   

Isatu runs a general stock business, moving around the environment to introduce her goods. She sells cigarettes, milk, pure water and drinks. She has been running this business since 1998. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Isatu says that at present her business is doing fine.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, bagged milk and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, bagged milk and drinks.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Mabinty from Rokupr from Northern area. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 2 years and 12 years. She began this business because she wanted to generate her own source of income to support the home.   

She runs a business of selling general stock items at her house. She sells cigarettes, milk, mayonnaise, pure water and drinks. She has been running this business for the past 5 years. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Mabinty says that at present her business is doing fine.

She has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, biscuits and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Sharavdulam

texts.en:
Sharavdulam, 38 years old, lives with her husband and three children in house on a fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling shoes to local people in a rented stall at an outdoor market for fifteen years. She usually collects her goods from wholesalers who import German and Korean shoes in large quantities. Her husband used to run a grocery store. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase materials and cover the costs of digging a deep water well near her greenhouse. This year they planted vegetables such as cabbage and potatoes and now plan to harvest them. This year's planting was a test to examine the fertility of land and the result was good enough. So she and her husband plan to grow vegetables in large quantities next year and they are solving its irrigation problem by digging a deep water well. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase materials and cover the cost of digging a well

loans.name: Tarav

texts.en: Mr. Tarav, 56 years old, lives with his wife in an old brick house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has four sons and one daughter, all of whom are married and live separately. Tarav has been working as a sentry at a high school for four years. His wife used to run a grocery store but now sells clothes which were brought from Korea by her son. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some serious repair. Tarav is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. After the renovation, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place, as well as reducing their usage of coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is a 60-year-old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. She has 3 grown children. She engages in food vending. She sells homemade meals like fish soup, fried chicken, stewed vegetables and other native items. She has been selling homemade meals for more than 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy kitchenware used in the preparation of the meals like frying pans, pots and a clay stove.  This will help Josie improve her income and serve her customers better. In the future, Josie would like to expand her food vending business to provide her family with a proper diet and good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware used in the preparation of the meals like frying pans, pots and a clay stove

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 48 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with three children. 

Nida has a hog raising business.  She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed and vitamins. 

Nida has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Nida hopes to venture into another business.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 39 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font tous le petit commerce de poissons frais. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Tapi (femme debout en 2ème  position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse dans le marché de Kalaban Coro de poissons frais de toutes les espèces. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 140 kg de poissons frais avec les pêcheurs. Elle se ravitaille à Kabala avec les pêcheurs au bord du fleuve Niger et parfois à Koulikoro.  La revente se fait en détail  à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Tapi espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Tout comme les autres membres de son groupe, elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made of eight married women, most of whom live as monogamous couples. On average, they are 39 and have six children. They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, which is the administrative centre of an area in Kati (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through their revenue-generating activities in the Kalaban Coro market. 

Each group member has her own fresh fish business. With the goal of growing their businesses, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second loan cycle as a group. 

Madame Tapi (the woman standing second from the left) is a major salesperson in the Kalaban Coro market. She sells a number of varieties of fresh fish. She would like to use her loan to buy 140 kg of fresh fish from fisherman. She gets her supplies in Kabala from the fishermen who fish on the Niger River and sometimes in Koulikoro.  

She resells at retail in Kalaban Coro, and the majority of her customers are women. Madame Tapi would like to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA that she'll use to reinvest in her business. Just like the other group members, she has a goal of buying a plot of land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Maria Lilian

texts.es:
María Lilian es una mujer soltera de 23 años de edad que desde niña se ha dedicado a apoyar a sus padres en las diferentes actividades que desarrolla en el campo como: limpieza, corte, fertilizar, etc. Ella actualmente vive junto a sus padres la cual tiene un grado de educación primaria completa gracias al apoyo por parte de ellos.
