Los cultivos de café que en familia trabajan están cerca de su casa de habitación a los cuales se trasladan a pie diariamente. El final de la cosecha en el momento de corte el producto es acarreado en vestía ya que el acceso para un vehículo no es posible por la falta de carretera; pero una vez fuera de sus tierras si es transportado en vehículo hasta los beneficios de la comunidad que tienen mucho prestigio los cuales están ubicados a 10 kilómetros de su casa de habitación.

Ella sueña con ampliar la parcela de tierra que sus padres le heredaron con mucho mas producto, con una mejor variedad, más competitiva y más atractiva. Es por ello que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 1 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 2 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0, 2 QQ de urea, 2 QQ de nutricafe, 1 QQ de formula cafetalera, 1 litro de insecticida y un litro de fungicida con el cual protegerá y asistirá sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María Lilian, 23, is single and has been supporting her parents in diverse farm activities such as cleaning, cutting, fertilizing, etc. since she was a young girl.  She lives with her parents and has a primary education thanks to her parents' support.  The coffee plantation the family works on is near their home and they walk to work every day.  At harvest time the crop is carried by mule because access with a vehicle is not possible for lack of a road.  The harvest is transported from their home by vehicle to the the most prestigious communities which are around ten kilometers from home.

María Lilian wants to expand the land she inherited from her parents so she can add more variety, become more competitive an offer a more attractive product.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy formula, urea, nutricafe, coffee treatment, insecticide and fungicide to protect and care for the crop.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Gestión Y Pequeño Negocio Group

texts.es:
Placida Victoria, tiene 37 años de edad, es socia del grupo "Gestión y Pequeño Negocio", nombre que los identifica ya que cada uno tiene su propio negocio y son organizados ya que tiene una meta común llegar a ser productores dueños de su propia empresa.
Hace dos años Placida Victoria inició su negocio de venta de ropa, en su domicilio tiene un ambiente destinado a ésta actividad, el cual está ambientado para poder atender a sus clientes, atienda damas, caballeros y niños, siendo su mayor clientela las damas.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir como pantalones jeans y un poco de chompas ya que aquí aun estamos en época de invierno.
texts.en:
Placida Victoria, 37, is a member of the communal bank "Gestión y Pequeño Negocio" which identifies the members because each of them has her own small business and the goal of becoming a productive company owner one day.

Two years ago Placida Victoria started a business selling clothing out of her home where she set up a space for her work.  There she attends to her customers: women, men and children; although most of her customers are women.

She will use the loan to buy clothing such as jeans and sweaters because they are still in the winter season.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane, age 34, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three kids, and her husband is a butcher. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood so she makes promising daily sales. Maryjane keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Maryjane believes that, with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Maryjane has been a member of PMPC for one year and 11 months. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain her status as a member in good standing. She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store and thus be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store

location.town: Sindangan - Diwait, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Ebenezer - Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
ELIART JARED, tiene 20 años, forma parte del grupo "Ebenezer-Dios con nosotros", el grupo está formado por 6 socios, todos ellos cuentan con un negocio propio.
Desde hace tres años Eliart Jared se dedica a prestar servicio como animador de fiestas infantiles, desde muy joven ha trabajado en celebraciones de cumpleaños de pequeños niños y también en eventos en los colegios, es muy carismático y tiene mucha paciencia con los niños por lo que tiene ya una clientela fija y estos mismos lo recomiendan.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la mejora de sus equipos electrónicos que utiliza para la animación de sus eventos.
texts.en:
Eliart Jared is 20 years old and is part of the "Ebenezer-Dios Con Nosotros" communal bank.  The group has six members, each with their own business.

For three years Eliart has been working as an entertainer at children's parties.  He has been working at young children's birthday parties and at school events since a very young age.  He is very charismatic and patient with children.  As a result he has a number of regular customers who also recommend him to others.

Eilart will use this loan to upgrade the electronic equipment that he uses for events.

loans.use: to invest the loan in improving his electronic equipment for events.

loans.name: Raquel Carolina

texts.es: La señora Raquel gracias a su esfuerzo y deseo de superacion,tiene su propiio negocio, venta de Ropa de Segunda, tiene 4 hijos, su compañero la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora como supervisor de Bodega para una empresa privada, con este credito doña Raquel comprara Pacas de Ropa, pero en esta ocasion dirigida a Niños ya que la demanda que recibe para ropa de niños es muy grande. con esto inversion espera que sus ingresos aumente y asi poder realizar sus metas. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en:
Raquel has her own used clothing business, thanks to her hard work and determination to get ahead.  She has four children and her common-law husband helps cover the household expenses since he works as a warehouse supervisor for a private company.  

Raquel will use the loan to buy packs of clothing, especially boys' clothing since she has a great demand for it.  With this investment she hopes to increase her income and reach her goals.  She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the support she is receiving from them.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Martha  Nohemy

texts.es: Doña martha de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de poliada desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras de su colonia, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad e higiene al preparar los alimentos, con lo poco que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Martha esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  ingredientes como: azúcar, leche, harina, canela, etc. y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old and lives in her own house together with her partner and three children. She makes a living selling poliada [a traditional dessert] at a place in the outskirts of her neighborhood. She has many customers due to her kindness and hygiene regarding preparation. With her earnings she is able to cover some home expenses.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy ingredients, such as sugar, milk, flour, cinnamon, etc., so as to be able to continue with her business, which is her sole means of income. With it she hopes to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, flour, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Francisca Del Pilar

texts.es: Francisca inicio su negocio hace 2 años  la  Venta de Smothies  y Frapes de diferentes sabores como Chocolate, mango,  fresa, oreo, piña colada y más , nos comenta que  el negocio  le ha  marchado  bien,  ella tiene planes de incrementar  más  variedad de sabores  y  satisfacer sus requerimientos y poder incrementar el número de ellos, por lo cual solicita un crédito   para  comprar  más   mercancía  y comprar   licuadoras y 2 mesas que le están haciendo falta y así  ella lograra  dar un mejor servicio a todos  sus clientes y tendrá mejores ganancias,  ella piensa liquidar su crédito en 1 año.
texts.en: Francisca started her business selling smoothies and iced-coffee two years ago.  She offers different flavours including chocolate, mango, strawberry, Oreo, and pineapple.  The business has gone well and Francisca has plans to expand, offer a wider variety of flavours and keep her customers satisfied and to increase her customer base.  In order to do this Francisca is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise and to buy liquidisers and two tables, which she much needs.  With these items she will be able to improve the service she offers to customers and will have higher profits.  Francisca plans to repay her loan within one year.

loans.use: to buy liquidisers, tables and more varieties of flavours.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 34 años de edad, vive en casa de un familiar junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y huevos desde hace 3 años, comercializa de formas ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio y es muy amable con sus clientes, Marcos está solicitando un crédito para la compra  de mas frutas, verduras y huevos por mayor para seguir con su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos is 34 years old and lives in the home of a family member, together with his life partner and two children. He has made a living selling fruits, vegetables and eggs for the past 3 years. He sells these itinerantly in the different neighborhoods close to his place of residence. He has many customers since he sells at a good price and is very kind to his customers.

Marcos is requesting a loan to buy more fruits, vegetables and eggs wholesale. He will use it to continue his business and to obtain more income, so as to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and eggs wholesale

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 31 years old and lives in Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Maricel has a pig fattening business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed and vitamins. 

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Maricel hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear his land

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 50 years old and still single. She lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Caroline has a computer business. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 8,000. Caroline has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

In the future, Caroline hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to pay for another computer unit.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una joven de 29 años de edad que desde muy joven adquirió los conocimientos en la agricultura especializándose en el cultivo de café siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran. Diariamente se levanta por la mañana a sus quehaceres diarios elaborando el almuerzo de su esposo para luego desplazarse al campo donde juntos elaboran las diferentes actividades como el mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales están pequeños y no estudian los cuales quedan a cargo de su madre mientras ella y su esposo están en el campo. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 4 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual diariamente se trasladan a pie.

Sus sueños son los de poder seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café para que en el futuro sus hijos pueda heredar una tierra digna y prospera la cual les permita tener una tierra donde vivir, donde trabajar y generar ingresos para sus hogares. Por esa razón ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 9 unidades de nutricafe, 4 unidades de abono 18-46-0 y 2 botes de abono foliar con los cuales dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café para  obtener una buena cosecha al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Martha is a 29 year old young woman.  When she was very young she gained agricultural knowledge, specializing in coffee crops.  Her parents were the ones who taught her.  She gets up every day and does the daily household chores.  She makes her husband’s lunch, and they then go to the field.  That is where they work together doing the different work like maintaining their crops.

She has two little children who do not go to school.  Her mother takes care of them while she and her husband are in the field.  Their coffee crops are four kilometers from their house.  They go there by foot every day.

Her dreams are to be able to continue expanding their coffee crops.  She wants to do this so that in the future her children will be able to inherit a decent and prosperous land.  The land will allow them to have a place to live, to work, and to generate income for their households.

That is why she is now requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative.  She will use the loan to buy nine units of ‘nutricafe’ [fertilizer], four units of organic fertilizer 18-46-0, and two bottles of leaf fertilizer.  She will use these to care for and maintain her coffee crops in order to get a good harvest at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Tugsbaatar

texts.en:
Mrs. Tugsbaatar, 49 years old, lives with her two sons in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a human resource manager at a food chain, where she has worked for 15 years. She began her career as a simple cashier at one of the chains, and last year she was promoted to human resource manager. Her younger son graduated recently and is seeking a job. Her elder son works in the countryside at a mining company. 

Tugsbaatar is requesting a loan of 5,100,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her old house. The renovation is necessary as winter approaches in Mongolia. The renovated house will allow her to burn less coal for heating, which will result in fewer pollutants being released into atmosphere. The borrower is a very hard working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is 28 years old and lives in Can-asagan, San Juan, Siquijor. He is single with one child, who is an infant. 

Edmund is engaged in fish vending to earn a living and has done this for five years. Each month, he earns 3,000 PHP. Edmund has requested a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional fishing equipment.
 
Edmund is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Edmund hopes to expand his living with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with seven children. She is 46 years old and lives in Deboloc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a chain saw operating business. She has been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP. She has been a member of PMPC for nine years.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to have more savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for another chain saw

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma.Liza is a 46-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children who are still in school. She raises and sells hogs as a source of livelihood.  

Aside from raising hogs, she goes fishing. Together with her husband, they work hand in hand to support their children.  She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy motorboat fuel, flashlights, batteries and pay the fee for motorboat repair to help improve her catch and earn more.  In the future, Ma.Liza would like to expand both of her businesses to continue to send her children to study and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy motorboat fuel, flashlights, batteries and the fee for motorboat repair

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 44 years old,  married, and a resident of Balik-balik, Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have two children, both of whom attend school. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. In addition to financial assistance, she enjoys other benefits of the co-op, including a savings account. She became a member in  August 2011 and has taken out four loans. 

Now she is applying for 6,000 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart. She will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store, particularly basic commodities

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married with 5 children.  Alma is 35 years old and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Alma has a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to pay for gallons of cooking oil, assorted biscuits and candies, and sacks of sugar.

Alma has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Alma hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for cooking oil, assorted biscuits and candies, and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plaster and paint.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Perveen’s husband owns a motorbike spare parts shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and his residence is near the shop. Her one son also helps her husband.  His shop is situated beside a huge and reputed spare parts shop. Mostly, customers like to buy from that shop due to its maximum variety of spare parts. He does not have a maximum variety of spare parts to offer to attract customers. 

To grow his business and income and to compete with competitors, he thought of a plan to offer more variety of spare parts because there are many motorbike workshops and a lot of demand for spare parts also.  Therefore, Perveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner in old age. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is a farmer and earns a meager income for her family. She is 61 years old, married, and a resident in Ozamiz City.

She has sought financial assistance from PMPC to buy farm inputs and fertilizers. This will increase her farm production and she will hopefully save a portion for her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: De La Mano Con Jesus Group

texts.es: La Alcancía “DE LA MANO CON JESUS” está integrada por 06 socias todas son amigas del mismo sector. Lilia de 27 años es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. Lilia se dedica a la cosmética dermatológica, realiza diferentes tratamientos de belleza a domicilio como limpieza de cutis, masajes y tratamientos de belleza.De esa manera apoya a su mama con los ingresos familiares, son muchos años que se dedica a este trabajo por lo mismo tiene muchas clientas que siempre requieren de sus servicios. El  préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos  como cremas, lociones y aceites. Lo que más desea en el futuro es iniciar su propio salón de belleza para poder atender a sus clientas con más comodidad. Lilia esta agradecida a los inversionistas de KIVA por este préstamo, en la foto es la ultima de la izquierda viste chompa color plomo; la foto agregada pertenece al Sr. Juan que pidió permiso para llegar tarde al desembolso.
texts.en:
The communal bank “De la Mano con Jesus” is made up of six members, all of whom are friends from the same industry. Lilia is 27 years old, single, and does not yet have children. She works as a cosmetician and performs various in-home beauty treatments such as facials and massages. She supports her mother with household expenses. Lilia has been doing this work for many years and has many customers who always request her services.

Lilia will use this loan to buy products such as creams, lotions and oils. Her greatest wish for the future is to start her own beauty salon in order to wait on her customers in a more comfortable environment. 

Lilia is grateful to Kiva lenders for this loan. In the photo, she is the last woman from the left wearing a gray sweater. 

The inset photo is of Juan, who asked to arrive late to the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions and oils.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a transport business, in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy two cars for his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a business that can comfortably support his family financially. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en: Cecille is 33 years old and lives in Cangbagsa, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with 3 children who are in school. Cecille has engaged in food vending and has had this business for 8 years. Each month she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amount of PHP 30,000 to be used in purchasing additional ingedients such as gelatin, pancakes, and bananas. Cecille has been a member of PMPC for 3 years and has shown good credit records. In the future, Cecille hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingedients such as gelatin, pancakes, and bananas

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
This is Mercidita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the materials that she needed. Her income from her business is helping her family's everyday expenses.  She has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mercidita dreams of expanding her business and of having a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and talk about microfinance.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 28-year-old single woman. She has two children aged five and 14 years. She describes herself as a risk taker. 

Sarah operates a retail store where she sells sugar, soap, vegetables and other consumer goods. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of salt, sugar and other consumer products. 

Her business goal is to expand the shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate and feed her children comfortably.

loans.use: add stock of salt, sugar and other consumer products

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been doing business in tailoring since five years ago to support her husband financially. She admitted that if her husband worked alone for their family, then he would not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. Both she and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continuously provide income for their daily expenses. 

Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

Fozia hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.  Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, reels of thread, buttons and laces for tailoring work.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a transport business where she transports customers using her motorcycle. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle to expand her transport business. Her business goal is to open a big spare parts shop within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be able to support her family comfortably. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle to expand her transport business.

loans.name: Shonali

texts.en:
Just over a year ago, the Kiva community lent $5,000 to Shonali enabling her to jump-start her gourmet food service, "Splendishes by Shonali". She required FDA approval, food labels, commercial kitchen space and ingredients and needed to hire her first two employees. These employees assisted with food preparation and allowed her to perform product demos to wholesalers.

Shonali has since produced a variety of award-winning items, most notably her horseradish mustard and red enchilada sauces, which won first and second places respectively at the Sonoma County Fair. Recently she has expanded into new product lines, such as kale chips, gourmet nuts and sweets. When asked how Kiva has impacted her business so far, she shared, “Growth is my biggest challenge, and it is frustrating to see huge businesses only get larger when small hardworking individuals are struggling to enter the market. … Kiva has helped me do that.”

Furthermore, Splendishes’ reputation continues to grow in the community. Shonali recently garnered the attention of nearby Palomar Airport. Impressed by her cooking, a local pilot helped her secure catering contracts to private aircrafts. Although catering for flights is a lucrative opportunity for her, being on call from six in the morning until ten in the evening can be quite a challenge. She shared, “I have to be able to cater at a moment’s notice, so I always have to be prepared!” 

Shonali is confident that her second Kiva loan will open up even more opportunities for Splendishes to expand. She will use the funds to hire two additional employees to enable her business to meet increasing demand as well as have a presence at multiple farmers’ markets simultaneously.

If all goes according to plan, Shonali hopes to ultimately have a commercial kitchen of her own instead of having to share a space with other companies. As for potential items available for sale in the future, Shonali says that she is open to making anything that delights her customers. “I’m always on the prowl to find something more delicious than what I made last!”

loans.use: to hire two additional employees to help fulfill a new contract for her gourmet food service

loans.name: Felicita  Candela

texts.es: Doña Felicita vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y un hijo, ella posee una sala de belleza desde hace mas de 10 años en su lugar de residencia,  es una persona amable, atenta, responsable y muy dedicada su trabajo, es muy reconocida en la zona, y muy preferida por sus clientes, tiene mucha demanda, además muy buenos ingresos, de esta manera ha solventado muchos gastos familiares, Doña Felicita solicita un crédito para compra de inventario como tintes, cosméticos, talcos, ganchos para el cabello,  etc. Para poder ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes, mejorar su sala de belleza, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Felicita lives in her own house with her partner and son. She has run a beauty salon for more than 10 years from her home. She is a kind, thoughtful, and responsible person who is very dedicated to her work. She is well-known in the area, and is preferred by her clients. She is in demand, and has a good income, so she covers a lot of household expenses.

Doña Felicita is asking for a loan in order to buy inventory such as dyes, cosmetics, talc, hairpins etc. so she can offer a better service to her clients, improve her beauty salon, increase her income and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dyes, cosmetics, talcs, hairpins etc.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 52-year-old woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. 

Joice operates a hotel where she sells food and drinks. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tables and chairs to use in the hotel. 

Her business goal is to open a bigger hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will support her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs to use in the hotel

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 26-year-old married man. He has one child who is 8 years old. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a cereals store where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a viable and busy area, and his primary customers are individual, commercial, and institutional customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital to purchase enough cereals. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of cereals for resale and rent a new business premise. His business goal is to be able to meet local and regional demand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cereals for resale and rent a new business premise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, maize flour, vegetables and other household items.

loans.name: Jaquiline

texts.en:
Jaquiline is married and has two children.  One is in school, and the other is still under school age.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over eight years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrián, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Tiene experiencia en el cultivo de papa ya que la zona donde vive es apta para este producto. Tiene una parcela donde siembra papa y esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un segundo ciclo a ODEF y este es por 9,000 Lempiras para poder comprar fertilizantes y semillas de papa y sembrar. La cosecha es por ciclos y el espera poder sacar cantidad y calidad de producto para obtener ingresos que le permitan cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Adrián is 34 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife, with whom he has 2 children, in the town of Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture, and he has experience in growing potatoes since the area where he lives is suitable for this produce. He has a plot of land where he sows potatoes and he sells his produce at the local market.

He has asked ODEF for a loan of 9,000 Lempiras to be able to buy fertilizers and potato seeds to sow. The crop is grown in cycles and he hopes to be able to yield quantity and quality in his produce to increase his income which will allow him to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds to sow.

loans.name: Julia  Estela

texts.es: Doña Julia vive en casa de propia, su esposo y sus hijos viven en EEUU, Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, es una persona amable, responsable, honesta y  dedicada a su trabajo, posee muy buenos ingresos ya que su negocio posee mucha demanda por la calidad  e higiene con que elabora sus tortillas, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos. Doña Julia solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales, cal y otros utensilios que se utilizan para elaborar las tortillas y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos, abastecer la demanda que posee y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julia lives in her own house. Her husband and children live in the United States. She has sold tortillas for the past few years. She is a friendly, responsible, honest person who is dedicated to her work. She has a good income and there is much demand for her product because of it's quality and cleanliness. Thanks to her efforts she has managed to pay some of her expenses. 

Julia is requesting a loan to buy corn by the quintal, lime and utensils she uses in the elaboration of her tortillas. She hopes that through this she will be able to create more income, fulfill the demand she now has and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en: Chita is 30 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with 1 child who is school-aged. Chita has requested a loan amount of PHP 35,000 to be used to pay for house renovation and furnishing. Chita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Chita hopes to expand their living with this institution.

loans.use: To pay for house renovation and furnishing

loans.name: Augustinha

texts.en:
A $ 1.000.00 loan is offered to Augustinha to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks, like papaya, coconut oil and chilli, to keep in her store.  She is generating a good income from selling.  

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.  She is happy with this loan because it offered hope for Augustinha to improve her living condition in the future

loans.use: to b  papayas, coconut oil and chilli.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business of selling leso(women wrap) cloths. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of Lesos for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of Lesos (women wrap cloths) for resale.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Amalia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Amalia hopes to make their fishing venture a success and a stable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer is a 30-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She grows and sells rice to earn a living. She has been growing rice for six years. Her husband works in a private company. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fertilizers in order to improve her harvest and gain more earnings. She would like to expand her farming business to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is 25 years old and married to Aljoroy. With her savings and effort, she managed to start her small grocery store providing different products. She works hard every day to have big sales. 

Laila is asking for a loan to buy a variety of products to sell, such as spices, beverages, canned goods, candies and more. This way she will be able to make greater sales for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell, such as spices, beverages, canned goods, candies and more.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a farmer. He is 43 years old, married, and has five children. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell for his family needs. He sometimes hires laborers to help him plant and harvest rice. He usually get an average net income of PHP 30,000 during harvest season and uses it to support his family's needs; what's left is utilized as revolving capital in farming. 

Reynaldo wanted to keep improving his farming business, that is why he is asking for a loan to buy three bags of rice seeds and eight bags of fertilizers for his farming. This will help maintain his good crop production. He hopes to become a successful rice grower someday.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and eight bags of fertilizers to improve his farming business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has two children in school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KSH 15,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a resident of Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman, and has eight children. Elsa has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Elsa is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fish hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. With this, they will be able to augment their income and save more money for their needs like food and for the school expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fish hooks.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is a 57-year-old woman from Jagna, Bohol. She is married with six adult children. Dionisia's husband is a rice farmer, and together they work hard to earn a living. She is also into raising hogs for additional income. Dionisia is asking for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy a piglet, supplements and feed.

She hopes that with the loan, she can continue to improve her earnings. She dreams of having enough savings for old age and more piglets to raise in the future. Her income will primarily be for food consumption.

loans.use: to buy a piglet, supplements and feed.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 46 years old, married to a farmer, and manages a farming business for a living. They patiently improve the growth of their crops in order to gain abundant harvest every cropping season. 

She wanted to keep improving her farm but had insufficient funds, that is why she is asking for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for their farming. 

Imelda promised to pay back this loan if it is granted, and will keep maintaining good harvest for the overall welfare of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for their farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a vehicle for mobile sales of his clothing line.

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en:
Arshad is 38 years old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children. She is a very hard-working and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. She owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband owns a barbershop near his house. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. 

Her children go to school in the morning and tuition in the evening. It is a challenge for them to afford the school and tuition fee, so both are doing a lot of hard work to run the set-up of their house. They always try to establish their businesses so that they can get maximum income.

Arshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will partially use this amount for her parlor and partially for the barbershop. She will buy cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, and scissors, and her husband will buy instruments such as scissors, comb, shaving cream, and blades for his barbershop.

She hopes that through this amount, both would be able to enhance their business. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for the parlor and barbershop.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: In the future, Ricardo hopes to achieve healthy crops for additional profits and to save funds for the development of his farming business and overall welfare of his family. He is 55 years old and a farmer living in Alcala. He is married, and his wife also helps him in their farming business to create a progressive living. They had two grown up children. He usually gets a net income of PHP 15,000 each harvest season. He would like to increase his crop output but had insufficient capital, which is why he is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides that he will use in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of chicken and firewood for resale

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling leso cloths (women's wraps) and handbags. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 30 pieces of Lesos and handbags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of Lesos and handbags for resale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business.  She is married, and she has six children.  She is running a business in her house selling petrol, diesel and kerosene.  She is making a good income from selling petrol, diesel and kerosene, and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. 

She is living a town nearby the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $600.00.  She has animals like buffalo, goats, chickens and horses.  She has a garden, and has plants like papaya, corn and bananas.

loans.use: to buy petrol, diesel and kerosene.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta, who is 30 years old, is married to a field technician in a private company in their province and they are blessed with two children. Loreta owns and operates two retail stores in her village, has been in this line of work for almost nine years, and earns a net income of PHP 1,200 a day. Due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy beverages, canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, noodles, bread and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
This is Jennelyn. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennelyn dreams to have a stall for her business and hopes for a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a businesswoman from Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is 68 years old with nine children. She is running a barbeque business that provides income for the family. She earns PHP 1,500 per day doing this type of work.  

She applied a loan to PMPC to buy additional kilos of meat for her barbeque business. She smiles at the thought of maintaining a good membership in this institution.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of meat for her barbeque business.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is a farmer from Pinopoc. He is married and has children to sustain with his wife. He patiently manages his farm, where he plants and harvests rice.  He also hires additional laborers who help him in planting and harvesting. 

He hopes for profitable harvests, and that is why he is now borrowing money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming. He hopes to ensure good growth of crops in order to abundantly harvest good crops. This will help educate his family and lift their living condition gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en: Mwanarusi is married and the mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past year, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She says seasonality is her biggest challenge. Mwanarusi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future, and is requesting a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For more than five years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwanakombo dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future, and is requesting a loan for Kshs 15,000 to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Felipa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Felipa de 43 años de edad vive en  casa propia junto a su familia, ella posee una tienda desde hace mas de 8 años en su lugar de residencia, es un negocio muy demandado en la zona ya que no posee mucha competencia, y además se ha llegado a ganar la confianza de sus clientes por su amabilidad y a los buenos precios que ofrece, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos. Doña Felipa solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería como golosinas, dulces, granos básicos, jabón, desodorantes,  etc. y así surtir mas su tienda y abastecer la gran demanda que posee, obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Felipa is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has run a shop for more than 8 years from her home. It is a very popular business in the area since she does not have a lot of competition, and she has also managed to gain the trust of her customers through her friendly nature and the good prices she offers. Thanks to her work she is able to cover a lot of her costs. 

Doña Felipa is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as sweets, basic grains, soap, deodorants etc. so that she can stock up her shop and supply the large demand she faces, increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, soap, deodorants etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 33 years old, married and the mother of two children. She earns a living by selling used clothing in the town of Kikuyu. She has been in this business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 shillings. This will be Alice's first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use it to buy more used clothing to sell. Her goal is to be a successful business woman in the future and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is taking out a loan for her husband who buys candies, biscuits, Rusk, bubbles and nimko from a whole seller and sells to the retailers. He has been doing this same practice for many years and earning sufficient income. He had been using his bicycle to carry and deliver the food items. He has built up good relations with his customers and is getting more offers to supply food items. He feels it's a problem to carry the goods from one place to another over bicycle. He decided to buy a used motorbike to carry and deliver the goods, but remains short of some amount. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy a motorbike and easily cope with the increasing demand. 

Faiza requested a loan for her husband because she hopes that her husband would be able to buy a motorbike and easily grow his monthly income. 

Faiza is 35 and a responsible mother of 5 children.  She says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for food salesman work.

loans.name: Myleine

texts.en: Myleine is 31 years old and lives in the town of Jagna, Bohol. She is married and the mother of two children, who are 6 and 9 years old. Myleine's husband is a vegetable farmer and they work together to grow and sell their produce. She also sells home-cooked meals like pancakes, chips, biscuits and siakoy (fried dough sprinkled with sugar). She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer. Myleine believes that her hard work will pay off eventually. In the future, she hopes to have more business opportunities so she can earn more money and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a woman of 34 years, married to Benson, and the mother of two children. She operates a grocery store, has a retail shop, and also sells charcoal in Kikuyu, on the outskirts of Kawangware. She has been in business for eight years now and makes a monthly income of 20,000 shillings.

This will be Maria's first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy groceries and cereals for her retail shop. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and cereals for her store

loans.name: Jemina

texts.en:
This is Jemina. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan so she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jemina hopes that her business will run smoothly and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 43-year-old shopkeeper and part-time farmer. She is married to Naftali, and they are blessed with three children. Rose has been running her shop for the past eight years with a monthly income of 7,700 Kenyan shillings, which she uses for her family's upkeep.

Rose is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, sugar and cooking fat. With the expected profit from the business, she will buy a motorbike. Her hope and dream is to buy a business car to enhance her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. Besides the M-pesa business, she sells lessos (women’s wrap clothes). She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase pieces of lessos for her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of lessos (women's wrap clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Roiner

texts.es: Roiner es un habitante de San Jacinto muy conocido por los moradores de este pueblo, ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar. Desde sus 9 años de edad, con la muerte de su padre, ha trabajado como ayudante de tiendas y esta experiencia fue la que convirtiera sus sueños en realidad. Por eso emprendió su propio negocio,  de vender ranchos, víveres, licores, bebidas frías, cárnicos y artículos de la canasta familiar al detalle, en las proporciones que sus vecinos pueden comprar para consumir diariamente.  El negocio de Roiner satisface las necesidades de consumo de su vecindad, mientras el continua construyendo más sueños de prosperidad, porque mas adelante se propone establecer tiendas en diversos varios del municipio y desde su negocio principal ampliado, distribuir los artículos a ellas y en puntos comerciales varios. Su trabajo lo hace con pocos recursos, porque no cuenta con un capital de trabajo que para alcanzar sus metas resulte suficiente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos, refrescos cárnicos, lácteos, verduras etc., el quiere aprovechar la gran experiencia que tiene en esta actividad y su juventud para lograr finalmente aumentar su bienestar.
texts.en: Roiner is very well-known by the inhabitants of his town of San Jacinto, in the Bolívar department.  Since the age of nine years old, when his father died, he has worked as a shop assistant in various places.  It was with this experience that Roiner was able to make his dream become a reality and he started his own business, selling meals, supplies, liquor, cold drinks, meat products and staple goods.  He sells the products in proportions appropriate for locals to come in and buy on a daily basis.  Roiner's business satisfies the needs of the neighbourhood and he is able to continue with his dreams of prospering further.  In the future he hopes to set up shops in various districts around town and then distribute products to all his stores, and to other businesses.  Roiner has very few resources to help him in his work. He has no working to capital so achieving his aims is difficult.  Roiner is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first with the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo".  He will use the loan to buy supplies, meals, drinks, meat products, dairy products, vegetables, and more.  Roiner wants to use his experience and his youth to his advantage so that he can eventually improve his well-being.

loans.use: to buy supplies, meals, drinks, meat products, dairy products, vegetables, and more.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta lives in Pinopoc where she and husband have a farming business in supporting the needs of her family. She is 51 years old and has three children. She usually gets an income of about PHP 20,000 each harvest, and this was used in sustaining her family’s daily needs. 

She is now asking for a loan that will be used in her planting season for buying the necessary seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. 

In the future, Violeta hopes to keep improving her farming output in order to gain more profits. Additional profits will be saved for the future expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is from the village of Mabbayad. She is well known to be a good citizen and recognized as a responsible mother of six children. She has been in this business for five years. Remedios is now 51 years old and is working hard to meet her family's daily needs. Her husband works as a farmer too for the family. 

Right now, Remedios wants to access a loan to acquire more fruit to sell such as apples, oranges, star apples, grapes and mangoes. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will keep improving her business towards its viability.

loans.use: to acquire more fruit to sell such as apples, oranges, star apples, grapes and mangoes

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 49 years old and comes from from Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol  Philippines. She is married with six children ages 10 to 21. Imelda sells home-cooked snacks like steamed rice cake and chips for a living. Her business started two years ago, earning her 2000 PHP on average per month. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy sugar, flour and milk. She hopes to make a good profit out of her business so she can reinvest her earnings and continue to provide for her family. 

In the future, Imelda hopes to make her business bigger and to see all her children successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and milk

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos de 21 años de edad,  es un joven que se dedica a la venta de minutos a celulares, y a la venta de helados.  Con este negocio genera ingresos para sostener a su familia, que la conforman su cónyuge y su hijo de 1 año de edad. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y agregar víveres, refrescos, pues no hay tiendas cercanas que a ello se dediquen, y esta es una necesidad sentída de la comunidad donde habita. La esquina donde vive y tiene su pequeño negocio, está bien ubicada y fue hace algunos años, una tienda de víveres y artículos de la canasta familiar, que lo lleva a pensar, en aprovechar la potencialidad de este mercado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  artículos varios de consumo diario, como víveres, ranchos, refrescos y bebidas. Con esta inversión dará curso a su sueño de prosperidad,  para empezar a trabajar por su sueño de crcimiento y generar muchos mas ingresos que beneficien el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21 years old and works selling pre-paid cell phone minutes and ice cream. He uses the income from this business to support his spouse and one-year-old child. His goal is to expand his business and add groceries and soft drinks, because no other nearby stores  sell these products. Carlos says he sees the need for this in his community.

The corner where Carlos lives and has his small business is in a good location. A few years ago it was a store that sold groceries and everyday items. He says this made him think he could take advantage of the potential of the location. 

This is Carlos’ first loan with Kiva and the field partner. He will use the loan to buy everyday items such as groceries, food, carbonated drinks and soft drinks. With the loan Carlos hopes to advance his dream of a better quality of life. He will work to expand his business and generate more income to benefit his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy everyday items such as groceries, food, carbonated drinks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en: Haitham is a 25-year-old man. He is married and has one child. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He sells furniture He saved a small amount to establish his business five years ago. This business helps him greatly, and he still has the opportunity to attract more customers. He is requesting a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB which he will invest in his business. Specifically, he will buy furniture such as curtains and carpets to expand his business. In this way, he will increase his income and ultimately have better living conditions in his area. He hopes that his loan will be funded by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as curtains and carpets to expand his business.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda, aged 48, is married to a company salesman and they are blessed with four children. She has owned and operated a transportation business for almost five years, and with this business she's earning a net income of PHP 600 daily. She would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can continue to improve her business to earn more profit.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Inez

texts.en:
Inez is a married woman and a mother of three children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. 

Inez is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Inez has hopes of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
This is Bernarda, 58, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a farmer, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bernarda operates a market stall. She sells some vegetables and different grocery items and toiletries. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different products like vegetables, vinegar, dried fish and some grocery items for her store.

Bernarda dreams that her sales will always be good and hopes that she and her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is there where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different products like vegetables, vinegar, dried fish and some grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad, su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 6 años, habitan en un municipio de mucha tradición artesanal y comercial en el departamento de Bolívar. Co el fin de generar ingresos para apoyar el gasto familiar, decidió emprender un negocio de ventas de verduras con sus hermanos hace muchos años. Poco a poco su panorama de vida fue ampliándose y con ello sus posibilidades de generar mas utilidades, por eso decidió invertir en ranchos, víveres, refrescos, carnes y lácteos, para venderlos al detalle, atendiendo que era una necesidad no satisfecha de sus vecinos en el barrio y de sus alrededores. Como se ubicó en un punto comercial donde estaba un pequeño negocio de tienda, logró impactar a su clientela y hoy sus deseos de crecer no se detienen. Su meta mas adelante es lograr tener un deposito y vender al por mayor, surtiendo las pequeñas tiendas que hay en la población.  Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr poco a poco cumplir su sueño de prosperidad, pero como tiene gran disciplina de trabajo, se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprar en mayor volumen productos de mayor rotación y vender a mejores precios. Con este financiamiento comprará ranchos, víveres, refrescos y otros artículos de la canasta familiar y sus inventarios estarán muy surtidos para impactar a su clientela fiel y a quienes no la conocen aun.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 35, lives with her husband and their two children, ages five and six.  They live a municipality with a lot of artisan tradition and commerce in the Bolívar department.  In order to generate income to support the family expenses, she decided to undertake a business selling vegetables with her siblings several years ago.

Little by little, her life picture was expanding, as were her opportunities to generate more profits.  Therefore, she decided to invest in snacks, groceries, soft drinks, meat, and dairy products to sell on a retail basis.  She took note that this was a need that her neighbors and people in surrounding areas had that was not met.

As she located herself at a commercial spot where there was a small store, she managed to impact her clientele.  Now her desire to grow is unstoppable.  Her goal for later on is to manage to have a warehouse and to sell wholesale.  This way she would be stocking the small stores that exist in the area.

Her biggest challenge is not having enough working capital to manage to, little by little, fulfill her dream of prosperity.  However, as she has great discipline in her work, she has approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan.  With the loan she will buy products with greater turnover in larger volume and sell at better prices.

With this loan she will buy snacks, groceries, soft drinks, and other basic needs items.  Her inventories will be well-stocked in order to impact her loyal customers and those that she has not yet met.

loans.use: to buy snacks, groceries, soft drinks, and other basic needs items.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 29 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife. He was married recently. 

For the past two years, he has been running his own grocery store, which helped him in gathering money and funds for his marriage. He sells different kinds of foodstuffs like soft drinks and kids’ stuff. He hopes that this youth loan will allow him to buy a refrigerator and shelves. He plans to open a supermarket in the future. 

Khaled is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and shelves for his grocery store

loans.name: Beka

texts.en: Beka is 23 years old, single, and lives in Tbilisi city with his parents and brother. Beka’s brother is unemployed at the moment. His father runs a small factory, producing tiles. Beka is involved in his newly started business of importing cars. He buys cars abroad and sells them in Georgia for a profit. Beka plans now to continue to work on his business and to make it grow. He applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or restart businesses. A loan of 1800 USD will help Beka to purchase more cars to resell for a profit. He hopes that his business will be profitable. With this financial support Beka will expand his car import business and have more working capital. He promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more cars for resale

loans.name: Bondades De Mujer Group

texts.es: Jeny  es socia de la alcancía “BONDADES DE MUJER”  conformado por  06  amigas dedicadas a diferentes negocios. Jeny  tiene 34 años es soltera y vive con sus padres a quienes apoya con su trabajo, son 09 años que se dedica a la confección de ropa  sobre medida  especialmente ropa para damas y niños. Durante todo este tiempo  ha logrado que sus clientas sean fieles a ella y siempre soliciten sus servicios de costura. Jeny  solicito este crédito para comprar materiales de costura y telas para  invertir en la confección de vestidos de promoción, mas adelante le gustaría ampliar su taller y comprar otra máquina de coser. Jeny esta agradecida a los inversionistas de KIVA por el préstamo de  su grupo, en la foto es la primera de la izquierda viste chompa color crema y pantalón jean.
texts.en:
Jeny is a member of the  “BONDADES DE MUJER” group communal bank, which is composed of six friends with different businesses. Jeny is 34 years old, single and lives with her parents who support her work. For nine years now she has made clothes to measure, especially for women and children. During this time she has made very loyal clients who always ask her for their sewing services.

Jeny is asking for this loan to buy sewing materials and cloth to invest in making promotional dresses. Later she would like to amplify her workshop and buy another sewing machine. She is grateful to the lenders at Kiva for the loan for her group. In the photo she is the first from the left, wearing the chestnut colored sweater and blue jeans.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and cloth.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en: Marwan is 27-year-old, single man who lives in a rented house in Taiz, Yemen. He works in a clothing store and gets a low income. He oversees the financial issues and responsibilities for his parents. He is an educated man who likes to read and keep up on the current events in the world. He does not have a television, so he applied for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy a television to use in his house. He hopes to improve his living condition.

loans.use: to buy a television to use in his house.

loans.name: Dilnavoz

texts.ru: Дилнавозу 44 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. Дилнавоз является одной из успешных учителей. Дилнавоз хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее дочь в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Ее дочь умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Дилнавоз должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilnavoz is 44 and married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. She works as a teacher in a high school and is one of the most successful teachers. Dilnavoz wants her children to receive a higher education. Her daughter, an intelligent and hardworking young woman, graduated from high school this year and applied to the Tajik State University of Commerce. Dilnavoz has to pay for her daughter's tuition, but doesn't have the money. She is requesting a loan to pay for education costs. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clean his plantation.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 42-year-old woman from Jagna, Bohol, Philippines. She is married with three children, ages 13, 18 and 19. For four years now, she has been operating a sari-sari store for an income. She sells canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, chips and toiletries in her store.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional inventory of canned goods, rice, detergent and bath soap. Rebecca hopes that the loan will really impact her planned improvements.

In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger and continue sending her children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, rice, detergent and bath soap to sell at her store.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Веселый парень из района Шахритус - Хуршед любит животных. Ему 26 лет и он привык получать от жизни все что возможно. Он женат и живет со всей своей семьей в джамоате Шахрак (что в переводе обозначает Городок) района Шахритус. У него есть просторное место во дворе. Пользуясь этим, Хуршед решил там устроить скотный двор. Но сумма начального капитала не достаточно для задуманного. Несмотря на то что у Хуршеда не далеко от дома есть маленький продуктовый магазинчик. 
Хуршеду с детства нравилось ухаживать за скотом и теперь, когда у него есть возможность, он может воплотить в жизнь свою мечту. Хуршеду нужно всего 1000$ для того чтобы приобрести бычков и телят для дальнейшего откорма и продажи.
texts.en: Hurshed is a happy guy from Shahrituz who loves animals.  He is 26 years old and he has gotten used to getting as much out of life as possible.  He is married and lives with his family in a little town of Shahrak in the region on Shahrituz.  He has a lot of space in his yard.  Hurshed decided to use this space as a barnyard. However, he does not have enough starting capital to make this into a reality.  Despite the fact that, not far from his house, there is a small grocery store, from the time when he was young, Hurshed always wanted to take care of cattle.  Now, he has the ability to do so and he can finally make his dream into a reality.  Hurshed needs $1000 to purchase bulls and calves so he can raise them and subsequently sell them.

loans.use: To purchase bulls and calves to start a business

loans.name: Elsavar

texts.en: Elsavar is 39 years old, married, and has 2 daughters. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli in Azerbaijan, who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. His wife stays at home while his daughters go to school, so he is the only one earning an income. Elsavar started his taxi business 4 years ago. Now he needs a loan of 900 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to change tires. In the future, he wants to buy a new car as this will be more profitable for his business. Elsavar is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to change tires on his taxi

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсуну 44 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, с которой он проживет счастливо на протяжении многих лет. Он более 7 лет занимается купле продажей продуктов питания. Его лавка расположена близко его дома и ему очень удобно развевать свой бизнес, так как все его соседи являются его постоянными клиентами. Он постепенно развевает бизнес и увеличивает оборотный капитал. С полученного дохода она улучшает условию проживания. Он планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как его дом имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, краска и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tursun is 44 and married to a wonderful woman with whom he has lived happily for many years. For more than seven years he has worked buying and selling food products. His stall is close to his house and it is very convenient for him to maintain his business, since his neighbours are his constant customers. He has gradually been developing the business and increasing his working capital. With the income received he is improving his living conditions.
