In her free time she sells beauty products.  Her loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil and beverages.  Her greatest goal is to expand her store and improve her family's quality of life.  

The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Rosalina is in the back row, second person from the left wearing a pink top and black sweater.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Oscar Jean Pierre

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven de 20 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de librería y con el fruto de su humilde negocio apoya a sus padres con algunos gastos del hogar  y poder solventar sus gastos de estudio, ya que actualmente el se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Técnico en enfermería.

Oscar está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar una maquina fotocopiadora para su pequeño negocio y de esta manera tener un ingreso mas y seguir adelante en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera”.
texts.en:
Oscar, 20, is a young man who has worked hard to launch his stationery business; and with the profits earned he is able to help his parents with some of the household expenses and pay for his education costs.  He is currently studying to be a nursing technician.

Oscar is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he can buy a photocopy machine for his small business to increase his income and continue toward his goal:  "To finish his degree".

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Karla Jackeline

texts.es: Karla, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 4 años que estableció su propio negocio de costura para la fabricación de ropa intima para damas, caballeros y niñas, como ser sostenes, blúmeres y bóxer. el taller lo tiene en su casa y vende en el mercado local.  Karla lleva 6 ciclos de préstamo en ODEF con el actual que es por 20,000 Lempiras, al igual que los anteriores los ha invertido en el negocio, con este nuevo préstamo va comprar telas que utiliza para la confección de ropa intima como sostén, boxes, blúmer para damas, caballeros y niñas. Su meta es acondicionar bien el taller en un local aparte y ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Karla is 39 years old, she is married, has three children and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Four years ago, she set up her own sewing business to make underwear for men, women and children such as bras, knickers and boxer shorts. Her workshop is in her home and she sells her goods in the local market. 

Karla is in her sixth loan cycle with ODEF, and this loan is for 20,000 Honduran Lempiras, just like the previous loans which she invested in in the business. With this new loan, Karla will buy fabrics which she uses to make underwear such as bras, boxer shorts and knickers for men, women and children. Her aim is to fit out the workshop properly on separate premises and to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy fabric for underwear.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco tiene 24 años de edad y tres de experiencia en el comercio de ropa para caballeros, especialmente camisas, suéteres y calzado. Francisco se encuentra estudiando mecánica en un centro de estudios técnicos en la ciudad, es muy sociable y por su comportamiento servicial con sus compañeros, ha logrado tener muchas amistades y de ello nació su inspiración, para iniciar su propio negocio. Como su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada, también capta clientes entre sus compañeros de trabajo que le fortalecen sus ventas, a crédito de lunes a sábados durante 9 horas diarias. Sus compras las realiza de contado y sus clientes son principalmente sus amigos y vecinos. Actualmente su meta a corto plazo, es  ampliar sus inventarios y tener una casa propia. Francisco está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará suéteres, camisas y calzado masculino, lo cual le permitirá surtir su negocio con mucho mas inventario exhibido a la medida de su clientela
texts.en:
Francisco is 24 years old and has three years of experience selling men's clothing, in particular shirts, sweaters and footwear. Francisco is studying mechanics in a center for technical studies in the city. He is very friendly and because of his helpful nature with his friends, he has managed to forge a lot of friendships and it was from this that his inspiration was born: to set up his own business. 

As his wife works in a private company, Francisco has also been able to attract customers among his wife's colleagues which strengthen his sales, with him working from Monday to Saturday for nine hours a day. He purchases his goods in cash and his customers are mainly friends or neighbors. 

His short-term goal is currently to increase his stocks and have his own home. Francisco is applying for a Kiva loan, his first request for financing via the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which with he will buy men's sweaters, shirts and footwear, which will enable him to stock his business with more goods on display to suit his customers.

loans.use: to buy men's sweaters, shirts and footwear.

loans.name: Maria Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora María  de  60  años de edad, vive con su esposo,  no tiene  hijos que dependan  de ella,  posee casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de pan, tortillas, tamales y venta de cuajada.
Doña María es una mujer trabajadora que se levanta temprano a ordeñar sus vacas para luego hacer tortillas por la mañana y por la tarde hornea pan, es un ejemplo de trabajo.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mil bloques,  con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende comprar los bloques para mejor su casa, es un buen cliente y vive en una casa bien humilde, es su cuarto préstamo que solicita a Prisma y está contenta por eso.
Doña María su sueño es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras- Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
María is 60 years old, she lives with her husband and does not have any children who depend on her. She owns her own home and for the last five years, she has been making her living selling bread, tortillas, tamales and cuajada curd. María is a hardworking woman who gets up early to milk her cows, to then make tortillas in the morning, and then bake bread in the afternoon - this is just an example of the work she does. 

María is seeking a loan to buy 1,000 bricks, and with the loan she will buy the bricks to improve her home. She is a good customer and lives in a humble home. This is the fourth loan that she is seeking from Prisma and María is happy about this. María dreams of improving her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks for her home.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” se encuentran muy contentos por estar pasando el 10 ciclo. Quienes se dedican a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Doris tiene 46 años es conviviente con dos hijos educando. En el grupo cumple la función de tesorera quien fue elegida por los socios del mencionado grupo. Hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, carne, queso en un mercado. Años atrás se dedicaba a la venta de tubérculos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más queso, carne y verduras. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio con la venta de frutas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Doris es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste casaca morado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Luchando por un sueño” (Fighting for a dream) group are delighted about having entered their 10th loan cycle. They make their living in a variety of activities for retail sale. 

Doris is 46 years old and lives with two children who are studying. In the group, Doris occupies the post of Treasurer and was chosen by the members of said group. For 15 years she has been making her living selling vegetables, meat and cheese in a market. Years ago she used to sell potatoes. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more meat, cheese and vegetables. Her most fervent dream is to expand her business to selling fruit. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders for the loan given. Doris is the second from the left wearing a purple jacket.

loans.use: to buy cheese, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Hijos De Grau Group

texts.es: El grupo “HIJOS DE GRAU”  lo integran 06 socias trabajadoras en  diferentes  negocios. Fara Del Pilar  de 44 años es la tesorera del grupo,  ella es casada con 03 hijos. Hace varios años se dedica a la venta de bebidas su negocio esta ubicadoen su casa donde atiende a su clientela, la mayoría de sus ventas la realiza los fines de semana donde le hacen pedidos para diferentes eventos, por otro lado también ofrece sus servicios como cocinera para diversas actividades festivas, gracias a los ingresos que percibe por su trabajo puede apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Fara Del Pilar agradece a los inversionistas por este préstamo que es un gran apoyo para ella y su grupo comunal, en la foto es la ultima de la izquierda viste chompa blanca con rayas negras, al costado se añadio la foto de Ntalia quien pidio permiso para ausentarse al desembolso.
texts.en:
The “Hijos de Grau” group is made up of six female members who work in different businesses. Fara Del Pilar, 44, is the group's Treasurer, she is married and has three children. For several years now, she has been making her living selling drinks. Her business is located in her home where she attends to customers. Most of her sales occur during the weekends when orders for different events are placed. Fara del Pilar also offers her services as a cook for a variety of festive occasions on the side. It is thanks to the income that she earns through her work that she can support her husband in her children's education. She will invest this loan in the purchase of drinks. Her biggest dream is to expand the business and for her children to become working professionals.

Fara Del Pilar is grateful to the Kiva loan lenders for this loan which is a source of great support for her and her communal group. In the photo, she is the last person on the left wearing a white sweater with black stripes. On the right, you can see the photo of Natalia who asked for permission not to attend the loan payment event.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Yusleydy Isabel

texts.es: Yusleydy es una joven humilde de muy escasos recursos económicos, tiene 22 años de edad y un pequeño hijo de 20 meses de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por encargos, y es de esta manera a como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Solicita el crédito para poder invertir en ropa interior de damas y caballeros, camisas, loción para bebes, perfumes de adulto entre otros, que le permita mantener las ventas y obtener sus ingresos con los cuales también mantiene gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Yusleydy is a humble woman of scarce financial resources. She is 22 years old and has a young 20 month old son. She makes her living selling cosmetics and clothes to order, and it is in this way that she sustains the household. She is seeking the loan to invest in men and women's underwear, shirts, baby lotion, perfume for adults and so on which will enable her to maintain her sales and obtain her income with which she also covers the household costs.

loans.use: to invest in men and women's underwear, shirts, baby lotion and perfumes for adults and so on.

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona emprendedora  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos y 5 nietos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de reses.  Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más  mercadería que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco la situación  económica  de su  familia. 
Doña María  espera que  en unos 2 años su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona, y seguir  apoyando a su familia, para que sus hijos y  nietos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas  con principios y valores para la  sociedad.

  
Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
María is an enterprising, honest and reliable person. She lives with her husband and their four children and five grandchildren in the south of Honduras. Her business is in the sale and purchase of livestock.

María needs the loan to buy cattle. With the loan, she hopes that the her business' sales will increase through the fact of having more merchandise to offer to customers and cover their needs, and in doing so, improve her family's financial situation a little.

María hopes that in two years' time her business will continue to grow and consolidate itself so that it becomes the largest and most well-known in the area, and continue to support her family so that her children and grandchildren finish their studies and become honest people with principles and values for society.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and a bag of used clothes.

loans.name: Claudia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 18 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 3 años a quien quiere muchísimo y es su razón de vivir, por ello cada día Claudia trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de carne de pollo y huevos, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con sus clientes.

Claudia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda ella podrá comprar pollos y patos enteros ya que tiene pedidos de varios clientes, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos, cumplir con sus clientes y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio y poder darle una buena educación a su hija”.
texts.en:
Claudia, 18, is the mother of a small child, 3, whom she loves very much and who is her meaning in life.  Because of this, Claudia works very hard every day to be able to get ahead.  This is why, with great effort, she started her business selling chicken and eggs.  She works around 9 hours a day and can serve up to 15 customers.

Claudia's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their big help she'll be able to buy whole chickens and ducks that several customers have ordered.

This way she'll be able to improve her income, meet her customers' needs, and continue striving to make her biggest dream come true: to have her own space and to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Jhosep Kyler

texts.es:
Jhosep es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jhosep pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Soldadura.
Por iniciativa propia, Jhosep trabaja como soldador en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Jhosep se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales y herramientas de trabajo, ya que los fines de semana desea trabajar en el taller mecánico de su padre, de esta manera podrá contar con un poco mas de ingresos económicos, los cuales utilizara para poder poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jhosep, 21, is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He's a very hardworking and enthusiastic man with a great desire for self-improvement.  Thanks to his effort and his parents' support, Jhosep was able to study welding in a technical program.

On his own initiative, Jhosep works as a welder in a business in his city.  He works every day for approximately 10 hours.  He believes it's going well for him because of his dedication and good performance.

Jhosep is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll buy materials and tools for work.  He wants to work in his father's repair shop on the weekend so he'll have a little more income to be able to study in a professional program.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools

loans.name: Carmen Del Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, ella es muy trabajadora y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Carmen no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Carmen trabaja vendiendo ropa y adicionalmente panes, ella recorre las calles de su ciudad para vender sus productos, trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para su venta, de esta manera atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Carmen seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 26, lives in the city of Chincha with her husband and her two small children.  She's very hardworking and puts all her effort into getting her family ahead.  Unfortunately Carmen wasn't able to study for a professional career in nursing because she lacked the economic resources and needed to work.

Carmen works on her own initiative selling clothing as well as bread, walking through the streets of her city to sell her products.  She works approximately 10 hours every day and thinks it's going well for her because of her dedication.

Carmen's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll buy a large quantity of clothes to sell so she can serve more customers.

Carmen will continue to work and make the effort to achieve her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon, age 42, is a garment worker. She lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons: one is a policeman and another one attends school.

Nowadays, Sokhon has a motorbike (in the photo) which is used by the family, and she wants to buy one more motorbike for her son who is a policeman to drive to work. That’s why she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 54 years old and she lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has three children. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Dolores is a retailer selling different products. She sells charcoal, vinegar, coconut, some vegetables and other products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

Dolores is requesting a loan amounting to 9,000 PHP that she will use in purchasing more stock of charcoal, vinegar, coconut and other products needed in her business.

Dolores dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of charcoal, vinegar, coconut and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her education fees

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
This is Richie, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Erwin, a caretaker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Richie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5-PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a direct selling business and a piggery for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Richie dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, en el distrito de Carhuaz, el es muy trabajador y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Marco no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Marco trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ollas y cuadros para el hogar, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Marco agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por todo su apoyo, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera atender a mas clientes, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marco is a 44 year old man. He lives in the city of Huaraz in the district of Carhuaz. He is very hardworking and dedicates all of his efforts towards getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and out of necessity, he had to start working very young, and Marco wasn't able to go to college.  

On his own initiative, Marco works in his small business selling pots and pictures for the home. He works everyday around 10 hours a day and thinks that it is going well for him because of his dedication and the good prices he offers his customers. 

Marco is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. Thanks to their help, he will buy a larger quantity of merchandise for his business. This way, he can serve more customers and keep working and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: San Miguel Misoure Group

texts.es: Simón tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. desde muy joven a trabajado en la agricultura, sobre cultivo de maíz, frijol y papa. la producción es vendida en el mercado local. Ha manejado varios prestamos en catorce ciclos con ODEF para mantener sus cultivos. Actualmente ha solicitado 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y semillas de papas, con el objetivo de darle buena asistencia y sacar mejor cosecha, siendo su plan obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. El préstamo es de forma grupal que se llama Sam Miguel Misoure, y esta formado por dos miembros, en la foto se identifican así: Simón de camiseta celeste y Ubaldo de camiseta azul oscura que esta a la izquierda. Los dos han solicitado 10,000 cada uno para comprar abono y semillas de papa para sembrar en este ciclo. Ellos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican  a la agricultura. El préstamo total grupal suma 20,000 Lempiras.
texts.en: Simón is 35 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He lives in a  community in he town of Intibucá. Since he was very young, he has worked in agriculture, growing corn, beans and potatoes. The crops are sold in the local market. He has managed several loans over fourteen cycles with ODEF to maintain his crops. Right now, he has asked for 10,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer and potato seeds to help him get a better harvest and obtain more income for his family. The loan is with the group called San Miguel Misoure, and it is made up of two members. In the photo, they can be identified as: Simón, in a light blue short, and Ubaldo, in a dark blue shirt on the left. They have both asked for 10,000 each to buy fertilizer and potato seeds to plant this cycle.  THey live in the same community and work in farming. The total group loan is for 20,000 lempiras.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Deyvis Junior

texts.es:
Deyvis es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres, el es muy amable, trabajador y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Deyvis no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que desea.
Por iniciativa propia, Deyvis trabaja como ayudante en un puesto de ventas de pescado, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Deyvis se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de alquilar de un puesto de ventas, ya que desea independizarse y vender pescados por su cuenta,de esta manera podría contar con un poco mas de ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Deyvis is a 19 year old man. He is single and lives with his parents in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial. He is very friendly and hardworking and dedicates all of his efforts into getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and because he has had to work, Deyvis hasn't been able to go to college and study agronomy, which he wants to do.

On his own initiative, Deyvis works as an assistant at a market stall selling fish. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he thinks it is going well for him because of his dedication and hard work.

Deyvis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to cover rent of a sales space. He wants to go off on his own and sell fish himself. This way, he can have a little more income, which will really help his achieve his dream of going to college.

loans.use: to rent a sales space.

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Sokhum (in the photo) is 56 years old. She lives in a village about twenty-three kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has eight children--four sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home; one is an electrician, two are garment workers and another one stays home. 

Sokhum and her husband are rice farmers and raise cows at home. In addition, they are also hired to put together fabric swatches. 

Sokhum is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
This is Florentina, 57, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Florentina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Florentina hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand and dreams of becoming rich.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married client from Iraq. He is 41 years old and has two children. Ali is the only provider in the family.

He owns a small shop and specializes in selling engine oils for various types of vehicles. He started working in this field in 2009, and after gaining sufficient experience, he chose this field as a career path. Ali is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 

Ali is requesting a sum of $2,400 USD to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his children a good education and a promising future.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his shop

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова, так как ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Она единственная кормилица своего ребенка. Она более 3 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она покупает ткань, шьёт женские платья и халаты и продает на местном рынке. Она шьёт аккуратно и имеет своих клиентов. Она использует полученный доход для обеспечения себя и своего ребенка. Она не имеет других источников дохода. Она имеет одну швейную машинку. Дилором хочет купить еще одну швейную машинку и ткани для развития оборотного капитала и расширения бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilorom is a hardworking woman.  She became a widow when her husband died a few years ago.  She is the sole provider for her child.  For more than 3 years, she has been working as a seamstress, sewing women's clothing.  She purchases fabrics, sews women's dresses and robes and sells them at the local market.  She sews with great care and has a number of clients.  She uses the income to provide the necessities for herself and for her child.  She does not have any other sources of income.  She has only one sewing machine. Dilorom wishes to purchase an additional sewing machine and fabrics to increase her working capital and to expand her business.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics to expand her business.

loans.name: Meslem

texts.en:
Meslem is a 23-year-old Iraqi youth client, who lives with his parents and his three bothers. Meslem, along with his father and one of his brothers, are the only providers for the family.

Meslem owns a small shop where he specializes in making unique rolls that are installed on a specialized piece of equipment and are used for cutting irons. Meslem established his business in 2012 after previously working for several years as an employee at a similar shop. Now, Meslem has a hired employee and is well known in the surrounding area for his excellent reputation.

Meslem is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide himself a good career and a bright future.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to support her studying.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a youth client from Iraq. He is 21 years old and lives with his family, which is composed of 11 members, of whom 5 are employed and take part in providing the family with income.

Haydar owns a general store where he specializes in selling plumbing tools and supplies. Haydar gained experience in this field through previously working at a similar shop as an employee for 2 years. In 2011, Haydar established his own business and now he has gained much fame and an excellent reputation, since he has no competitors and is the only person with such a profession in the neighborhood.

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing new shelves and a new sunshade and to increase his inventory. Haydar is aiming to grow his business and open a bigger shop one day so that he may provide more services for his society.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing new shelves and a new sunshade and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is an Iraqi youth client, who is 26 years old and lives with his parents and his three brothers. Zaher, his father and one of his brothers provide the family's income, while his other 2 brothers continue their studies.

Zaher owns a small shop where he provides printing, faxing, and photocopying services in his neighborhood. He has been practicing this business since 2010, and since then he has been gradually earning fame and respect since he is the only person with such a profession in the surrounding area.

Zaher is applying for a youth loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. Zaher is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide better income for his family in order to help his brothers in continuing their education.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Creb's Group

texts.en:
Creb, 49, is married with two children residing in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she has been farming rice while her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 26,000 Riels (KHR) per day and can save about 11,000 KHR each day for  future needs.

Creb's group consists of two members who are both women. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Creb is going to use her portion of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family's income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to support his studies.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
This is Arceli, a 38-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. Married to Ronaldo, a worker abroad, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.


Arceli operates a fruit and vegetable stand, buying quantities of fruits and vegetables to sell per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.


To help her continue operations of her business, Arceli is requesting a Php9,000 loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her family will always thrive. 


She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru: Абдухалил 54 года. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Абдухалил более 3 лет занимается предоставлением услугой такси. Он предоставляет свои услуги на высшем уровне и его клиенты довольны его услугами. Абдухалил является основным кормильцем семьи. Он должен провести мероприятия похороны, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения мероприятия похороны. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abduhalil is 54 years old.  He is married and has 5 children. For more than 3 years, Abduhalil has been working as a taxi driver.  He offers premium services and his clients are very happy with his work.  Abduhalil is the sole provider for his entire family.  He needs to organize a funeral, but has not money to do so.  He is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to pay for the funeral services.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for the funeral expenses

loans.name: Sajad

texts.en:
Sajad is a married Iraqi youth client, who is 18 years old and lives in his parents' house and helps his father in providing the family income.

Sajad owns a small grocery store where he sells dairy products, canned food, snacks, detergents and shampoos. He has been in this field since 2011 and has good experience in what he practices. Thanks to his competitive prices, Sajad became well-known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Sajad is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy two new refrigerators and to install a display window. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and to install a display window

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr: Judith est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. elle possède une boutique depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des emballages plastiques. ce crédit, qu'elle sollicite, va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et profit. Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir sa boutique et augmenter son capital d'une part, et d'acheter un terrain dans 2 ans d'autre part.
texts.en: Judith is a woman of 31, single and without children. She has owned a shop for three years in a district of the town where she sells plastic bags. This loan that she is requesting will allow her to expand her stock of merchandise so as to satisfy her growing clientele and increase her turnover and profit. The profit generated will allow her to enlarge her shop and increase her capital on the one hand, and on the other hand, to buy a plot of land two years from now.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Voern's Group

texts.en:
Voern, 38, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province's Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, two of whom are attending school. For the last 18 years, Voern and her husband have been farming rice on one hectare of farmland. The current business earns her about 25,000 Riels (KHR) per day to meet the family's needs.

This is the first microloan for Voern with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mirzoaly

texts.ru: Мирзоали 26 лет. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Он работает 8 часов, 6 дней в недели. Мирзоали более 6 лет занимается предоставлением услуги парикмахера. Он знает все тонкости своего дела и отлично введет свой бизнес. Так как он живет в деревни, он не имеет конкурентов. Местные жители уважают его и любят. Он в месяц зарабатывает 1500 сомони и на эти деньги они живут. Его жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Он планирует провести мероприятия дома, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1600 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mirzoaly is 26 years old.  He is married but has no children.  He works 8 hours a day, 6 days per week.  For more than 6 years, Mirzoaly has been working as a barber.  He knows all of the nuances of his trade and runs his business successfully. Since he lives in a small village, he does not have any competitors.  Local residents love and respect him.  He makes 1500 somoni each month, which are used on his family's living expenses.  His wife helps him with running the business.  

He is planning to have a celebration at his house, but does not have the money to do so.  He is asking for a loan of 1600 somoni to organize this event.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To organize a celebration.

loans.name: Twizigirane Group

texts.fr:
Rosalie fait partie du groupe  Twizigirane  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à  Sylvestre,  un militaire. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 6 à 8 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce du riz, du haricot et du charbon de bois  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capitale et acheter une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, de charbon de bois à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins familiaux (soins de santé, alimentation,…).
texts.en:
Rosalie is a member of the group  Twizigirane  and lives in Gitega. She is 27 and married to Sylvestre,  a soldier. Together they have three children, between 6 and 8 years of age. 

Rosalie has been selling rice, beans, and charcoal for six years. She is on her fourteenth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she is receiving, she is going to increase her working capital, and buy a big quantity of rice, beans, and charcoal for resale so that she can earn more. 

Thanks to the income from her business, she manages to satisfy the family's needs (healthcare, food, etc.)

loans.use: to expand her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Alinson Alberto

texts.es:
Alinson es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Alinson no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Economía que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Alinson trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Alinson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las paredes de su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un profesional.
texts.en:
Alinson is a 22 year old man, single, and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona with his parents and siblings. He is hardworking, enthusiastic, and has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, he could not study for a career in economics as he wanted.

On his own initiative, Alinson works on a farm in his city as a field laborer. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks he is doing well because of his dedication and good performance.

Alinson is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help he can make improvements to his housing. He wants to strengthen the walls of his home as well as continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his housing

loans.name: Fassokounawolo  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Fassokounawolo 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  N’gara  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Babou (1ère femme debout à  gauche dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village N’gara. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the group called Fassokounawolo 2 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 41 and on average, two children each. They live in the village of   N’gara  in the region of  Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural activities or because of bonds of neighborhood, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. With the aim of buying tools and stocking up on agricultural inputs, the members of the group found Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth seasonal loan. 

Madame  Babou (the first woman standing, from the left in the photo) is very active in rainy-season agricultural activities in the village of N’gara. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizer, and then pay young people to weed her field. The sale of her agricultural produce is made for cash at the end of the rainy season, to repay her loan and so as to have income to cover the needs of the children and part of those of the family.

loans.use: to buy tools, seeds, and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mirzokarim

texts.ru:
Мирзокариму 30 лет. Он живет с женой, детьми, отцом, матерью и братом в районе Джиликуль. В свои 30 лет у него богатое прошлое и большой список его интересов. В данный момент Мирзоракиму нужны деньги для покупки автомобиля, чтобы предоставлять услуги такси. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. До этого времени он работал в России и недавно вернулся из заработка. Он накопил сбережение в размере 1000 долларов. У Мирзокарима большое хозяйство. У него пару кур, 2 коровы и один любимый конь. 
Мирзокарим купив автомашину планирует работать по маршрутной линии Джиликуль-Кургантюбе и в день делать два рейса. Он очень ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Mirzokarim is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife, his father, his mother, and his brother in Jilikul.  During his 30 years of life, he acquired a rich set of experiences and a long list of interests.  Currently, Mirzokarim  needs money to purchase a car to start a taxi service.  This is why he is asking for a loan.  Previously, he had worked in Russia and returned to Jilikul only recently.  He had accumulated $1000 dollars in his savings.  Mirzokarim has a large household.  He has couple of chickens, two cows, and his favorite horse.  After purchasing the car, Mirzokarim is planning to work on the route between Jilikul and Qurghonteppa, making two round-trips per day.  He is waiting for support.

loans.use: To purchase a car so he can start a taxi service

loans.name: Genesis Pamela

texts.es:
Genesis es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Genesis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Genesis trabaja como vendedora una tienda de venta de ropa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Genesis se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para reforzar las paredes de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Genesis is a 25 year old woman, living in the city of Pisco with her young son. She is a kind person, hardworking, who dedicates all her efforts to supporting the family. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and because of the necessity of working, Genesis could not study for a professional career.

On her own initiative, Genesis works in a clothing store in her city as a sales clerk. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and thinks that she is doing well because of her dedication and good performance.

Genesis is grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help she can make improvements to her housing. She wants to buy construction materials to help strengthen the walls of her home as she continues working and striving to achieve her big dream of having her own store.

loans.use: to make improvements to her housing

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, esta soltero no tiene hijos vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja en el Ministerio de Metereologia donde percibe un sueldo mínimo, el credito que solicita es para pagar una maestría y de esta manera poder obtener mejor nivel y percibir un sueldo mayor donde trabaja, lo que gana actualmente apenas le alcanza para vivir
texts.en:
Israel is single and has no children.  He lives at his parents’ house in the city of La Paz.

Israel currently works for the Ministry of Meteorology where he earns a minimal salary.  The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for a Masters-level course so that he can achieve a better position and earn a higher salary at the place he works.  At the moment, he barely earns enough to live.

loans.use: to pay for a specialization course.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem, a 34-year-old married father of two from Iraq, is his family's sole provider. Kareem owns a small shop selling fresh chicken, an enterprise he established 2011; he now has one employee. He has achieved good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area, enjoying an excellent reputation. 


Kareem is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a specialized piece of equipment used for cleaning the feathers off of chickens as well as more chickens to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase profits in order to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment and more chickens to sell

loans.name: Fassokounawolo  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Fassokounawolo 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  N’gara  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Kadia (femme assise au milieu des assises dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village N’gara. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women of the group called Fassokounawolo 3 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 43 and on average, three children each. They all live in the village of   N’gara  in the region of  Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural activities or because of bonds of neighborhood, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. With the aim of buying tools and stocking up on agricultural inputs, the members of the group found Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth seasonal loan. 

Madame  Kadia (seated in the middle in the photo) is very active in rainy-season agricultural activities in the village of N’gara. She intends to use her loan to plow her field, buy seeds and fertilizer, and then pay young people to weed her field. The sale of her agricultural produce is made for cash at the end of the rainy season, to repay her loan and so as to have income to cover the needs of the children and part of those of the family.

loans.use: to buy tools, seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Gafor

texts.ru: Тот, кто придумал такие слова «…и в счастье и в беде, и в горе и в радости…»- он наверняка представлял такую пару как Гафора и его жены. Действительно, они женаты очень давно, и прошли через огонь и воду. У них два сына и трое дочек. Дочек уже выдали замуж. Первый сын работает в школе учителем, второй уехал на заработки, за границей. Сам Гафор работает сторожем в местной школе. Он задумал открыть свой бизнес «купля, откорм и продажа скота». Ведь он знает работу на скотном дворе не понаслышке. Единственной проблемой для него оказалась нехватка денег. По этой причине он просит кредит, чтобы закупить бычков и начать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
He who came up with the phrase, "in good times and in bad, in sickness and in health" was surely imagining a couple such as Gafor and his wife.  They have been married for a very long time and together, they have passed through fire and through water.  They have two sons and three daughters.  The daughters are married off. Their one son is working as a school teacher and the other went abroad to make money.  Gafor works as a security guard at the local school.  

Recently, he decided to open a business in cattle sales.  He knows the intricacies of such work first-hand.  His only problem at the moment is a lack of funds.  This is the reason why he is asking for a loan.  He wishes to purchase cattle to start his new business.

loans.use: To purchase bulls to start a cattle sale business

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
This is Amparo. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amparo dreams that her tricycle will always be in good condition and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Gisela Noemi

texts.es:
Gisela es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres, ella es una persona trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Gisela no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Obstetricia.
Por iniciativa propia, Gisela trabaja como personal de limpieza en una empresa de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Gisela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar un pequeño televisor, el cual la mantendrá atenta a las noticias de su ciudad, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Gisela, 19, is single and lives with her parents in the city of Ica, in the Parcona district.  She's a hardworking and enthusiastic young woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  Gisela wasn't able to study in a professional program for obstetrics because she lacked the financial resources and needed to work.

Gisela works on her own initiative on the cleaning staff in a business in her city.  She works approximately 10 hours every day and thinks it's going well for her because of her dedication.

Gisela's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a small television set to keep up with the news in her city.

She's going to continue to work and make the effort to achieve her big dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy a television set

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta separada del esposo, tiene una hija y vive en casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como docente en un instituto, donde percibe un sueldo mínimo con el cual mantiene a su hija, ya que el esposo la dejo hace tres años, el crédito que solicita es para pagar los estudios de  culminación de su hija que estudia administración,
texts.en:
Maria is separated from her husband.  She has a daughter and lives in her own home in the city of La Paz.  

Maria currently works as a teacher at an institute where she receives a minimal salary for supporting her daughter.  Her husband left them three years ago.  The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her daughter’s studies.  She is in the process of completing a degree in Management.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university studies.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Karutsi  est secrétaire du collectif  d’affaire  « Confiance», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée et  mère de 8 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un artiste peintre. La cliente s’est déjà spécialisée dans la vente de plastiques (bassins, gobelet, objets ménagés plastiques, etc.). Elle a choisi être opérateur d’un seul article dans le quel, elle sera plus compétitive. Elle installe ses articles au marché central. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a environ 3 ans. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter les plastiques (10 douzaine de bassins, 5 douzaines de gobelets, 4 douzaines de plats, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses  enfants. Le capital de rotation insuffisant est un grand défi pour son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Hekima client Karutsi  is the secretary of the business group called « Confiance», a young, experienced and the mother of eight children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is an artist who paints. This client is already specialized in selling plastic items (bowls, mugs, plastic household goods, etc.) 

Karutsi has chosen to sell one single sort of merchandise so that she will be more competitive.  She displays her items in the central market. She began her business with an IMF Hekima loan around three years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy plastic items (10 dozen bowls, 5 dozen mugs, 4 dozen serving dishes, etc.) In this way, she wishes to grow her business, pay school fees for her children, and feed them. Insufficient working capital is a great challenge for her business. She would like to end by expressing a hearty thanks to Hekima for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy plastic items (10 dozen bowls, 5 dozen mugs, 4 dozen serving dishes, etc.)

loans.name: Reyna Marisela

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de 22 años de edad es casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa gracias al apoyo de los padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Hoy en día lo practica junto a su esposo el cual es agricultor y cultivan café ya que la zona donde ellos habitan por su clima y su tierra es apta para dicha actividad la cual es sustento y medio de ingreso para su familia y para muchas otras de la zona. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está cerca de su casa de habitación.

Su sueño es ampliar su tierra adquiriendo más para poder cultivarlas con otra variedad de café ya que de esa manera ella podrá asegurar los estudios de sus hijos por lo que podrá generar más ingresos. Al mismo tiempo fortalecerá el patrimonio para sus hijos por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 6 QQ e formula 18-46-0, 6 QQ de urea, 6 QQ de nutricafe, 6 QQ de formula cafetalera, 2 litros de insecticida y 1 litro de fungicida con lo que protegerá sus cultivos de café asegurando el grano y protegiendo la planta para el final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 22 year old woman who is married and the mother of 2 children who are studying in primary school in different grades. She was able to complete primary school thanks to help from her parents and they themselves taught her to work the land at an early age.

Today she works with her husband who is a farmer growing coffee close to where they live. The climate and land is good for this activity and is the means to their family livelihood and for many others in the area. The land they work is their own thanks to an inheritance from her parents and is close to their home.

Her dream is to expand her land, acquiring more land in order to grow other varieties of coffee as in this way she will be able to ensure that her children can study and they will be able to generate higher income.

Today, as she strengthens an inheritance for her children, she is asking for funding from communal bank COMIXMUL in order to buy 3 quintals of 12-24-12 formula, 6 quintals of 18-46-0 formula, 6 quintals of urea, 6 quintals of nutricafé, 6 quintals of coffee formula, 2 liters of insecticide, and 1 liter of fungicide so that she can protect her coffee crops ensuring and protecting the crops for the final harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her cultivate her fields of coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her education fees.

loans.name: Mawuko

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Mawuko. She is married and has one child aged eleven years old, who goes to school. In 2005, Mawuko established her business selling cosmetics (cream, quitters, perfume, wigs, weavon and other beauty products). She began her business because as the second child of five, her parents were poor and could not afford to send all of them to school. She had the chance to attend school up to the secondary level, and therefore she is educated enough to read and write. She is using her educational background to operate her business successfully. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns a very respectable profit every month from this business. She would need a loan of GHS 1,700 to buy cream, quitters, perfume, wigs, weavon and other beauty products and resell to customers. In the future, she plans to improve her business and her family. She is looking forward to the funding as she requires more capital. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cream, quitters, perfume, wigs, weavon and other beauty products and resell to customers.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Los Olivos De Pro Group

texts.es: Giovanna de 24 años  tiene 02 hijos pequeños. Giovanna y su esposo trabajan  para  el bienestar de sus hijos, hace algunos años se inicio en la venta de  productos de belleza empezó su negocio ofreciendo  productos a sus familiares y amistades, en la actualidad tiene muchas clientas quienes le solicitan diversos productos como perfumes, maquillaje y accesorios de belleza.Por otro lado los fines de semana prepara dulces para vender  en su casa  a acondicionado algunas mesas y bancas  para atender  a sus ocasionales clientes. Giovanna esta agradecida por tener trabajo para ayudar a su familia. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza quiere seguir invirtiendo en ese negocio que le deja mejores ganancias. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener casa propia para poner un negocio estable, en la foto es la 6ta de la izquierda esta sentada viste chompa negra y pantalon celeste.
texts.en: Giovanna is 24 years old and has two small children.  Giovanna and her husband work for the well-being of their children. A few years ago they began selling beauty products and thus began their business offering products to their family and friends.  Currently they have many customers who ask for diverse products such as perfumes, make-up, and beauty accessories.  In addition, on the weekend they make sweets to sell from their home, setting up some tables and benches to wait on their occasional customers.  Giovanna is thankful for having work that helps her family.  The loan that she receives will be invested in purchasing beauty products. She wants to keep investing in this business so that it will provide better income.  Her greatest dream in life is to have her own home in order to create a stable business.  In the picture she is the 6th from the left and is seated wearing a black sweat shirt and light blue pants.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Mathias has been working hard to manage his beverages business, which sells sodas and beers. 

To help expand his business, Mathias has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used for business expansion into a wholesale shop and will help Mathias to generate greater profits and to bridge the financial gaps in his business. Mathias hopes that in the future he will be able to provide quality products. 

Mathias is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mathias who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand his business into a wholesale shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits, such as passion fruits, mangoes and oranges

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old Iraqi client who lives in his parent’s house and takes care of his widow mother.
 
Ali owns a general store and specializes in selling tools and supplies. He has been in this field since 2011 and has gained good experience in what he practices. He now has an employee and has become well-known in his neighborhood. 

Ali is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing a display window and increasing his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to take better care of his mother.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a display window and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 24 years old and lives with his family consisting of five members, of whom two are employed and help Mouhammad in providing the family living.

Mouhammad is a grocer and owns a grocery store, where he sells all the basic needs of a house like dairy products, snacks, canned food, juices and detergents. He has been in this field since 2008, and through time, he gained much experience in this field. Mouhammad now has an employee hired and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a big motor generator for his grocery store to keep his products fresh. Mouhammad is aiming to grow more in this field and someday open a bigger grocery store in order to sell more products and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide himself and his family better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a big motor generator for his grocery store to keep his products fresh.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is a 38-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years with the support of her husband. Kousar sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has five children, and she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life. Kousar has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her third year with BRAC Pakistan.
 
Kousar is happily running her business, but she needs money to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

She says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for getting milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his education fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to support his studying.

loans.name: Mwanamwisho

texts.en:
Mwanamwisho is a married woman with three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamwisho operates a food-making business, making staples, such as beans, chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passerbys and neighbors. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future

loans.use: to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella es muy amable, trabajadora, dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Gisela no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Secretariado que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Gisela trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Gisela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera ella atenderá a mas clientes, así pues Gisela seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Gisela is 37 years old and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and two children. She is very kind and hard-working, and puts all her efforts in getting her family ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work, Gisela was not able to study to become a secretary as she once wished.

By her own initiative Gisela works in her small business selling everyday goods and drinks. She works for approximately 10 hours every day, and thinks she does well because of her dedication and the good prices she offers to her customers.

Gisela is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will buy a higher quantity and a larger variety of merchandise for her business. In this way she will attract more customers, and thus Gisela will keep working and making an effort to achieve her great dream to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Isolina

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 59 años de edad, está acompañada desde hace 38 años su pareja es panificador y agricultor tuvieron en común 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno vive con ellos, solo dos nietos de 10 6 años de edad  que están estudiando básica

Ella aprendió a elaborar pan, desde que estaba muy joven tiene 19 años  de dedicarse a la panadería decidió hacer esa actividad; porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia y colaborar en los gastos de la casa. Con su compañero de vida,  instalaron su propio puesto de panadería, antes se dedicaban a vender pan pero lo compraban hecho. Hoy en día ellos lo producen, va a comprar los insumos a la ciudad, recorre 34 kilómetros, paga transportarse.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  harinas, azúcar, miel, entre otras. El préstamo mejorara su negocio porque tendrá la oportunidad de satisfacer la demanda del pan, ya que es bastante.
Desea, seguir haciendo pan y abrir  sus propias tiendas de pan en todo el municipio donde vive. Su  sueño es producir pan para exportarlo pues considera que lo elaboran muy rico, para que su familia vivan mejor. Con las ganancias desea, adquirir otro horno, para panificar y que la producción abunde más. Así quiere ampliar su negocio
texts.en:
Blanca is a 59 year old woman, accompanied by her life partner for 38 years, and she is a baker and a farmer.  They have 4 children, none of whom live with them, and they have only 2 grandchildren who are 10 and 6 years old attending primary school.

She learned to bake bread from the time she was very young and 19 years ago she decided to dedicate herself to the bakery because she didn’t have another way of helping her family with the household expenses. She and her life companion opened their own bakery shop. Before they had sold bread that they bought, now they make it themselves, buying the supplies in the city, traveling 34 kilometers, paying for transport.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, honey, and other items. The loan will improve her business because she will have the opportunity of meeting the demand for bread, which is high.

She wants to continue making bread and to open bread shops in all the nearby neighborhoods. Her dream is to bake bread to export because she considers her bread very tasty and she wants her family to live better. With her profits she wants to buy another stove so she can bake bread and produce more. She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, honey, and more items for her bakery.

loans.name: Dora's Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of two members who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Dora, is 35 years old and has a secondary school education. With the goal of boosting their business in order to cope with the demands of their customers, this group is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana for the third time. Both are into the sale of eggs, soap, fruit drinks, candles and Milo. 

Dora is married to a loan officer named Addo. The couple have one child, who is not in school but in their care. She lives together with her husband and child. The couple jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. For this reason, Dora has been selling eggs, soap, fruit drinks, candles and Milo for 7 years. She gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

With the goal of increasing her level of business and satisfying her customers, Dora along with the other member are requesting a loan from ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy eggs, soap, fruit drinks, candles and Milo and sell them to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate and expand the cafe premises.

loans.name: Bolodombolo Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Bolodombolo sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Bamanan-Zambougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, du lait et de condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bah (femme debout à l’extrême droite  dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac  de riz avec les exploitants à Konodimini en gros. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et à Konodimini  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Bah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the group called Bolodombolo are married, mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 35 and on average two children each. They all live in the village of  Bamanan-Zambougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and they met through ties of neighborhood, kinship, and through their money-earning activities in the village. They sell cereals, milk and condiments. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to work together  with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Bah (the woman standing on the far right of the photo) intends to use her loan to buy one sack of rice wholesale from the farmers in  Konodimini. The resale will be done for cash and credit from her home and in Konodimini  to a clientele composed mainly of women. Madame Bah hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 f CFA with this loan which will be used to cover the needs of her children and to grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing and toy business

loans.name: Yngrid Yasmin

texts.es:
Yngrid es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Yngrid pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería.
